reviews.content: Snatch is a fine film. It is a way to look through today´s world. One might say that is a strange film, an  odd movie that sometimes annoys you... but it is not that way at all. it is in my opinion an artcraft of modern cinema and Guy Ritchie is one of the best film directors of the moment. he is a little bit like Tarantino...perhaps more strange in fact. i do recommend Snatch with no doubt.

This movie at first did not have my attention when i saw the previews. I waited for it to come out on video and then rented it one night when not knowing what to see and having it recommended to me by my brother. The movie instantly grabbed my attention and held it till the end. I enjoyed not only the story line and the fine acting, but also the unique style to it. It has a narrator to give you the in-site on some things you may bot be understanding. This movie had everything going for it. All in all, a great movie.

Nice cast but the movie doesn't make any sense. There is a continuous stream of sketches that has a little bit of humor and a little bit of crime that supposed to make the movie cool. The final result is pretty tiring.

If you enjoyed Lock Stock etc you will definitely enjoy this follow up film from Guy Ritchie. In the same genre, with once again an intertwining of East End shady characters after the same goal, plenty of blood and guts, shootouts, and of course, humour! To me, compared to Lock Stock the story line and connection of the characters was a bit clearer to follow and it was pleasing to see Vinnie Jones have more dialogue as well. The funniest scenes were the three black guys in the car and also the attempt at robbing the bookies (especially when trying to escape through the door!). I was impressed with Brad Pitt's character and the fact that he was prepared to make the movie for a huge cut in fees (and I also notice his name was not top of the bill). If nothing else it is refreshing to see a big star be prepared to do a movie because they want to. The type of movie only the Brits can do - and don't they do it well!.

The brilliance of this movie lies in the directing technique by Guy Richie.The real stars are: 1)Camera movement 2)The Fast Pace of the story 3)Time Morphing (you see an event then after a while you know how it happened).It is a very amusing-to-watch gang story, that combines action & witty comedy that you see rather than hear. Brilliant performance by everyone and it is great that someone like Brad Pitt comes for a small but excellent role. The film is quite popular in Egypt though it was never released in the cinema.

I understand not everybody is going to like a good movie. There are a lot of really good movies that I know just aren't up my alley so I don't bother watching them, but if you talk bad about this movie I will fight you. :) Just kidding, great movie.

reviews.review_title: You can't make a better flick than this....Seriously
reviews.content: Come on, what do you want from a movie.....that it should entertain you right from the beginning till the very end. This movie is absolutely on the same lines, it never lags, it is so funny that you might want to take a break while watching the movie to come back to your senses again. Jason Statham is a typical action movie guy unlike Ben Stiller, Jim Carrey or Adam Sandler but the uncharacteristic wittiness shown by him is just atrociously hilarious. This has to be one of the best movies of all times. For me this is already at no. 3 after "The Sting" & "Lock, Stock & Two Smoking Barrels". Hats Off to Guy Ritchie & the entire cast of this movie.....everything is just perfect. Go & enjoy a roller coaster comic ride, a ride you'll never forget.

Guy Ritchie's Snatch is a fun, snappy crime caper populated by flash geezers, psychotic gangsters and inept boxing promoters. The plot - involving a stolen diamond - is almost of secondary importance to the visuals and quickfire dialogue, but is helped along through devices and coincidences and propelled by Ritichie's now - trademark visuals.This is very much a continuation in the same vein as Lock Stock . . and features some of the same actors including ex-footballer Vinnie Jones, Jason Statham and Alan Ford who has a memorable turn as the ruthless Brick Top. Statham's boxing promoter Turkish and his dimwitted accomplice Tommy find themselves"on thin fackin' ice" after a fight they rig doesn't go according to plan. Pikey bareknuckle champ Mickey O'Neill (Pitt) incapacitates their original fighter, thereby forcing them to use him in the match. Told to throw the fight, O'Neill instead puts his opponent down with one punch, incurring the wrath of Brick Top and placing them in the one place no sane person wishes to be - in Brick Top's debt. Meanwhile, three even stupider crooks attempt to recover the diamond from Franky (Del Toro) with hilarious results. I'm from Ireland and find Mr Pitt's pikey/traveller accent hilarious. But, it suits the over the top tone of the film perfectly. The violence and the Cockney one liners are fast and furious. I'm not going to go into much more detail, so I'll just say the film is extremely good fun and deserves a repeat view.

Guy Ritchie's done it again! As was "Lock, Stock...", "Snatch" is everything you could possibly want in a British Comedy and more. With it's quick-witted one liners and its hilarious plot it really brings out the best in the likes of Jason Statham and Vinnie Jones. But the best performance of the whole movie has to go to Brad Pitt for his portrayal of Mickey O'Neil, the hard-drinking, bare-knuckle boxer who could knock out even the largest of fellas with one deadly punch. Pitt proves that he isn't just a pretty boy of Hollywood and that he can vary his performances in accordance to the film that he is starring in. Take for example his performance as O'Neil in "Snatch" to his performance as Achilles in "Troy". OK "Troy" may not be the greatest of films but there is a big, big difference in characters. "Snatch" is the perfect lads movie. Guns, money, bookmakers, boxing, stolen diamonds, robbers, gangsters and to top it all of...it's a comedy and it's British! With its snappy dialogue and side-splittingly funny, villainous Londoners I highly recommend this movie!My Rating : A Brilliant 9/10

reviews.review_title: A fantastic black comedy that will have you in splits
reviews.content: Guy Ritchie is known more for his romance and marriage to Madonna but he is a very talented filmmaker and snatch is a prove of this. This dark comedy/crime caper is an absolute laugh riot with some amazing dialogues that will have you rolling and characters you will remember for months. Rooted in the London Underworld Snatch is about a stolen diamond and believe it or not- boxing. How these two come together is for you to see and judge. Great performances, tidy flow and expert direction makes Snatch a must watch.

The 'sequel' if that's the right phrase to 'Lock Stock...' is more of the same but with more of the elements that made the first film stand out; whizzy camera effects dancing round a similarly convoluted plot in which an even larger dose of rather unpleasant underworld characters all get their heads down for a spot of verbal and physical banter. The lack of a central core of 'good guys' makes rooting for any of the characters harder, so just sit back and enjoy the violence & humour full on. Vinnie Jones is bigger & better as Bullet Tooth Tony with some great dialogue thrown his way this time and the thoroughly unpleasant Brick Top (Alan Ford) is one mean bastard that you just want dead as the film climaxes.More full on than Lock Stock but less believable, this is a pumped up adrenalin fuelled 'go faster' version; more muscle, less fat and so possibly not quite as tasty for everyone but still a cracking 2 hours of escapism......

This movie was so good!!!  It was not exactly what I expected it to be, but then again I really had no clear picture about what it was.  It was kind of about diamond-smuggling, after all, the whole movie revolves around a humongous diamond.  But it is very hard to say exactly what the movie is about.  It has several different plot lines that all weave together in to one story.  It was very funny, I laughed until my stomach hurt, and it had THE BEST ending I have seen in a movie in a long time.  The acting was superb, Brad Pitt was hilarious, along with all the other actors I had never seen before.  You have GOT to see this movie!!!

reviews.review_title: Lock Stock and a Rock : an entertaining disappointment
reviews.content:
If LSA2SB was your favourite film then there is no doubt that you are going to lap up this 2nd slice of stylised cockney hi-jinx. if you are expecting an improvement you may be disappointed.Snatch tells the story of a couple of boxing promoters who get into a spot of jeopardy. When their prize fighter is lamped by a pikey' (gypsy) played by Brad Pitt), they are forced to turn to him in order to save their neck from a local wideboy named Bricktop.Despite his ropey lingo, Brad Pitt easily steals the show with some terrific lines and some prolific punching.There are lots of other elements to the film, diamonds, yardies, dogs, guns and armed robberies, not to mention bareknuckle fighting that has all the intensity seen in FIGHT CLUB.The disappointing thing about Snatch is that, once you've heard a bit about it, the stars, the plot, the style!, it gives you an unachievable sense of expectation. That said, it is still one of the best example of small-time-blundering-cockney-gangster movies to come out of Britain.
Another let down was Vinny Jones, he's featured in a variety of cringe-worthy in jokes (one featuring a like for like car door/head scene). He doesn't have the subtly of BIG CHRIS in LSA2SB, he seems a little too smug.Overall it is a very entertaining hour or so, it feels like a more like one of the Lock Stock TV series rather than a new film in its own right.
I think that the Lock Stock TV series severely undermines this film by already giving us a full set of 'pass the booty' shows , a formula that Guy Riches seem (more than a little) attached to.Not as fresh as LSA2SB, but more brutal and a lot funnier. 8/10

excellent film but not near as good as Mr. Ritchie's tour de force. I refer to his re-make of 'Swept-Away'. Who knew the director could sing and direct? Like a pro ball player in two sports! Go figure. I mean, lock stock was good, he got me interested, got me thinking there was more to this guy than crooning blue heads in las Vegas. Along comes Snatch avec proof he's no flash in the pan but with SA he seals the deal. Swept II - all too late in the coming arriving not a moment too soon. & the casting, Madonna!!!!! How did he ever get her? I guess she needed the work. Hopefully this film will be re-released in IMAX 3D so we can really feel the force of this powerhouse classic.A pen-ultimate piece of work. Sublime. All I can say is touché Lionel.

This movie was the best comedy of all times! I specially liked the jokes about the Russians, because most of them were the reality. And Brad Pitt as the gypsy boxer was just great, i just wonder how long did it take to learn talking like that. Anyway, as i already said, this movie is really good! Guy Ritchie is a genius!

reviews.review_title: THE man's movie of the year...violent and outrageously funny
reviews.content: This is the man's movie of the year...it has two of the three primary things men love in a movie: plenty of extreme violence (the worst things are slightly below the bottom of the frame), and simultaneous hysterically funny visual humor.  The collection of characters are all fascinating; the plot is complex, but the breathtaking pace of the journey through its twists and turns is (with a single very moving exception) delightful; the score is perfectly chosen to support each scene, and the acting is an ensemble tour de force, not the least of which is Brad Pitt's dedicated performance.

Similar to Lock Stock and 2 Smoking Barrels but if it ain't broke... Guy Ritchie uses the cast of lesser known British actors to good effect and contrary to expectations, Brad Pitt adds a lot to the film. The only criticism would be that some of the music, e.g. Golden Brown & Dreadlock Holiday, seems to be squeezed into the movie presumably for the benefit of the ubiquitous soundtrack album.

Turkish (Jason Stathem) is a struggling boxing promoter who just wants to earn a living promoting boxing. He and his wanna be tough friend, Tommy (Stephan Graham), find out the hard way that certain people should not be dealt with if you want to stay out of trouble. Two of the people they find out who shouldn't be messed with is, One Punch Mickey O'Neil (Brad Pitt), and one boxing promoter/ Kingpin, Brick Top (Alan Ford). Turkish and Tommy end up dealing with these two characters and realize that there is so much more to them then meets the eye. Mean while there is a huge diamond that has been stolen and every gangster and mob man wants it. This adds a whole big twist in lives of not only local gangsters and mob men, but also local jewelers and thieves. While Turkish and Tommy end up trying to deal with their new "friends", the whole rest of the gangster community fights over the diamond. Though out the whole movie the diamond changes hands and in the end, it ends up with the most unlikely character.This movie had great potential and came through. It was a great action comedy that kept me glued to the screen. It had everything from Fights to Shootings, to people getting limbs chopped off. Great, I know. The comedy that went with it was something that of a man getting hit in the privates. You know you shouldn't laugh but it was so hard not to. It was mostly dark humor, dealing with death and violence so you kind of feel bad for laughing but they set it up in a way were it worked.The British dialect was a bit hard to follow at the beginning, but after a while you get used to it. It was definitely one of those movies that you would have to watch again just so you could catch every thing that was said. The hardest character to understand would have to be Brad Pitts. They do this on purpose because he is supposed to be a non-educated gypsy that no one can understand, but again as the movie digresses you start to learn the dialect and get to love his character.This movie had lots and lots of characters, but seemed to keep them under control. It reminded me of the movie "smoking aces", in the fact that there were many characters. Almost too many in the beginning but the movie did a great job of either killing them off, or just kind of pushing them aside and you forgetting about them. It also jumped around a lot. They would go from character to character and not give a lead to the scene change. I some what enjoyed this part of the movie but others could very easily get lost.The narrating part done by Jason Stathem really did add something to the movie. He has played in other movies were he has played the bad ass that beats everyone up. In this role he really does show that he can actually act. I am a big fan of the starting a movie at the end of a movie and the narrator going back trough and telling you how they got to were they were. I think when directors do this they always have a great way to end the movie. In this movie they definitely pulled it off.So I would have to say you would really enjoy this movie if you don't mind the dark humor with violence. If you love stories were there really is no really clear cut good guy. It doesn't end like you thought it would and tons of big guns and people getting what they deserve, you should definitely "Snatch" up this movie.

Now don't get me wrong, I practically swear by this movie, but I stillrecognize the fact that Snatch is 95% style. The characters, theincredible cinematography, and the crazy and unorthodox editingtechniques really make this film stand out. And I hate to say it, butSnatch really is Oliver Stone without the substance. Anybody who hasever seen Platoon or JFK knows what I'm talking about. So, though I dorecommend this movie for anybody who doesn't have a heart condition, Iwill not call this a great film. But there's no written rule that says amovie can't be great and still be knock-your-socks-off enter

Simply amazing. Guy Ritchie is the european Quentin Tarentino. Snatch is really funny. Brad Pitt is not that smarty boy like in his other movie (except of Fight Club of course)but in such movies you see what a great actor he is. All the other guy were also great. I liked Turkish and Tommy best (and the dog ;-)) I would recommend this movie to everybody and especially to all Quentin Tarentino lovers.

The first night I went to watch this movie (opening night) I was completely blown away.  The sound and cinematography worked perfectly.  The script was good, the characters excellent and the actors were actually good actors.This was not just a movie, it was an experience unlike any other.That was on the first night.  Three shows later I still think this movie is amazing and I'm starting to see more and more little hidden tidbits.I suggest you get to this movie ASAP.

reviews.review_title: Guy Ritchie works his magic again
reviews.content: I had no idea what to expect when I went to see this film.  I was happily surprised at what I saw.  Guy Ritchie is another director who knows how to use high quality music video style, snappy editing and directing.  Ritchie has written another wild, snarled plot in the tradition of Pulp Fiction. Actually, this film is extremely similar to Lock, Stock, and Two Smoking Barrels - identical would not be a stretch.  But Ritchie is not plagiarizing - L, S, and 2SB is his film also. Like Run, Lola, Run, the music video style is used here only where it helps the film, not impedes it.  The most inventive use takes us across the Atlantic in about 3 seconds - you'll have to see it to know what I mean. Almost all the characters have incredibly thick accents, requiring complete attention on the part of the viewer to catch the dialogue.  But that only adds to the overall quirkiness of the film.  All the actors are fairly good. The one who really shines, though, is Brad Pitt.  He wallows in his seediness in this film, and appears to love doing it.  His impenetrable Irish accent is really impossible to decipher, and creates some very funny moments. The other thing Ritchie plays with is time.  A spectacular scene where three cars and three story lines interact is done in reverse.  This scene is absolutely hilarious and very inspired. Warning note to guys:  This is quite the guy's film.  Think twice about taking a date with you to this one. With that said, I need to go reserve my copy of the video before it comes out.  10/10!!!

What can I say. It's been ages since I've had the opporotunity to feast my eyes upon such an elaborate masterpiece. With whacky characters, all with unique and hilarious personalities, the film excels in demonstrating how greed can drive humans of all sorts to such extremes as dismembring limbs, feeding people to pigs, and burning down caravans. The brightest point in the film is without a doubt Brad Pitt playing Micky, a bare-knuckle boxing gypsy. His attitude, facial expressions, and strange,almost ununderstandable accent will keep you laughing from the first meeting between him and Turkish, to the startling climax at a boxing match. The rest of the movie which includes a man with a briefcase attatched to his arm, crude gangsters, and a dog will leave you with a complete feeling of satisfaction despite the questionable overabundance of violence. Overall it is a definite 10/10, if you can stomach it.

reviews.review_title: Top Film from Top Producer and Top Director
reviews.content: This film is certainly in my top 5 of all time. Right next to Lock Stock. A film I have to rewatch regularly, as it is so good. If you haven't seen it yet I suggest you do, as you are missing out. All the actors are brilliant, especially Statham and Jones. Mike Reid (better known as Frank Butcher in Eastenders) even top Drum and Bass DJ, Goldie is in it. WOW. The Best

reviews.review_title: Why do I want to buy a caravan that's got no wheels!
reviews.content: Bradd Pitt always pleases in his roles and is obviously good on the eye but for me this is my favourite character he has ever played great film with plenty of humour and a British classic.

One of the best movies I have ever seen..I don't know what to say first. Very clever dialogues, excellent implicit humor, the characters just lovable and Brad Pitt in one of his best performances..Of course that would be unfair to mention only Pitt because everyone in the movie acted great, but Pitt is in a kind surprising role.Guy Ritchie wrote and directed an amazing film with so many different characters demonstrating a comical view of the underworld, contrary to the commonsense. The beyond compare humor of the movie stays at the most appropriate level and never is too much..It is a movie that can be seen again and again.Guy Ritchie proves after ''lock, stock and two smoking barrels'' that he is here to stay. Well done..!

reviews.review_title: Worth the art of it all.
reviews.content: This film doesn't hesitate to get right to the action.  The opening credits alone were a draw for me.  The fast frame, freeze action was masterfully done.  Throughout the film, the viewer is given the eyes of several of the characters, by use of the camera, which was quite enjoyable.  The use of different angles really emphasized the emotion and tasteful action of each scene as well as evoked a sense of interaction with the viewer.  The line between what's reality and what isn't becomes really thin when the viewer becomes engaged as such. One thing, though, the accents were hard to follow, so for me, watching the film was a bit of work, but well worth it in lieu of the art of it.

A very funny film would get 10/10 if it was not for the poor Irish accent of Brad Pitt (Mickey O'Neil), Vinnie Jones (Bullet Tooth Tony) plays his usual hard man but plays it very well. But for me the Dog takes the Star Roll.

reviews.review_title: This was not what I was expecting.
reviews.content: I first heard about this movie when I was looking at the films I hadn't seen from the top 250 list and I read about this. I thought that it would be a very simple and boring movie. But when I saw it I was pleasantly surprised. Although the storyline is pretty simple, the way it is done is not as simple as it sounds. Most of the characters become involved with the diamond whether they like it or not.But what makes this film so interesting. Well for starters the script is full of many funny comments. The acting is also absolutely wonderful. Especially Brad Pitt. Also the editing in some scenes like the milk drink scene keeps you guessing about how the scene will end. Then there is also the boxing scenes, especially the final one that is done by using a mixture of slow motions and still shots. And finally, there is the fun and exciting soundtrack that goes with it.If you liked lock stock and two smoking barrels, then you'll love snatch.

I know this is a really bold statement but Snatch is my favorite movie. The mix of Pitt, Stathom and Del Torro with the direction of Guy Ritchie works perfectly. The badassness mixed with the comic relief through the film is beautifully done. I love how all the story lines keep you guessing throughout the film and in one scene come together in a very unexpected way. The feel of the film reminds me of a Tariteno film with more of a MTV feel which works well with the storyline. The sarcastic and dry British humor keeps the laughs going without venturing to far from the dark somber feel of the plot. It shows how greed and make and break you all in the matter of a week. Snatch is the Usual Suspectsmixed with Lock Stock and Two Smokin Barrels on roids!!! What more could a movie lover ask for?

My favorite thing about this film was the characters, it was almost like a comic book because of so many unique characters. the acting is good, some performances better than others. I do feel that the movie wouldn't of done that great at all without Brad Pit, i feel that its his greatest performance, that accent is terrific. The end of the movie was good but kind of unoriginal in my opinion.I think That Guy Ritchie has talent and this film shows it, but sometimes he bombs terribly. He shows his talent with the many different camera angles that happen in rapid succession. I think people will like this film because of Turkish, he is extremely clever and reliable, people want to be his character. Overall the film was enjoyable, i do recommend it.

This is an Excellent Movie by Guy Ritchie. good Story line and Excellent Preference by Bra Pitt Best Ever Acting of Brad Pitt and Jason Stathem doing his role perfect Overall a good movie and Happy to watch again and agin.This is an Excellent Movie by Guy Ritchie. good Story line and Excellent Preference by Bra Pitt Best Ever Acting of Brad Pitt and Jason Stathem doing his role perfect Overall a good movie and Happy to watch again and agin.This is an Excellent Movie by Guy Ritchie. good Story line and Excellent Preference by Bra Pitt Best Ever Acting of Brad Pitt and Jason Stathem doing his role perfect Overall a good movie and Happy to watch again and agin

Snatch. I watched it the first time 2015, the second and third time 2016. I mean when Jason Statham plays an illegal box promoter and Brad Pitt a Yankee, what do you want more? I was so surprised about the story lines which cross each other. The film is just a masterpiece and one of my favorite films of all time! Statham had his debut also in a Guy Ritchie film: Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels. But in Snatch he is much better and plays an important role. Of course Guy Ritchie made films like Sherlock Holmes or Codename U.N.C.L.E. but this flick is just a masterpiece. I don't wanna spoil anyone, watch it on your own. 8 out of 10 stars.
Just awesome movie, my one of favorite movie i just love this movie , logan my favorite hero

reviews.review_title: If you've seen Lock Stock, you've seen Snatch
reviews.content: If you loved Lock Stock, you'll love Snatch - just don't expect anything different - the later is almost a remake of the former in terms of characters, scenarios, the rhythm - though the pay off in Lock Stock seemed to me slightly more satisfying than Snatch.Where Snatch excels is in the humour and the pacing - two things Guy Ritchie is a natural at.The highlight for me:Brad Pitt's character of Mickey manages to steal this movie - and there are LOADS of memorable characters.

reviews.review_title: Hilarious gangster comedy with original photography and good story line
reviews.content: I can only confirm the comments of the previous commentator, but perhaps add that, if you are a guy, you may not have to fear your girlfriend does not like the movie because of the violence. Although there is violence in the movie, most of it is indirect and actually very originally shot (as is the whole movie) --- but apart from that, Pitt's performance is just grand with his incomprehensible accent, not just to mention his performance in the boxing ring, which may also be appreciated by your girlfriend. By the way: I noticed one minor possible blooper --- when discussing about a camper for his mother, a dog suddenly jumps up to Pitt and that frightened him somewhat while uttering the four-letter f word, and then continued with his lines but with a smile on his face --- I don't think it was part of the script, though. Did anybody see this as well? Anyways --- great movie, I like it more than Pulp Fiction!

Everyone seems to want to compare this movie to Guy Ritchie's earlier work, "Lock, Stock, and Two Smoking Barrels" and I have no comment one way or the other because I haven't seen "Lock, Stock.."  but I have to say this is one of the funniest plot-driven movie I've seen within the last year.  I was surprised to the extent to which I enjoyed; I usually stay away from "Brit flicks", but this movie grabbed me from the opening scene to the last. It's hard to look away from the screen. Partly because it takes concentration on the viewers part just to figure out what's being said. It's also interesting to see Brad Pitt in a role where he doesn't necessarily dominate the movie's screen time, yet manages to make his relatively few scenes work to make him the ultimate protagonist. I give this movie a *** 1/2 out of ****. Go see it. If you have seen it, see it again.

reviews.review_title: Style over content, but manages to work
reviews.content: With the initial fear that Snatch would serve as little more than a Lock, Stock part 2, I was pleasantly surprised by what turned out to be a better acted, and in places, better paced second film by Guy Ritchie. Although at times the editing does much to jar the flow of the story, it still manages to hold the attention, and provides a number of great set pieces and laughs. Praised for his first foray in front of the screen in Lock Stock, Vinnie Jones goes one better in this film with an extremely good cameo. It is also great to see the underrated Benicto Del Torro in use, all be it under-used yet again. Brad Pitt manages to work a great comedy performance out of his boxing pikey, and, with the labourious Nick Moran and the ridiculous Dexter Fletcher dropped for this film, the acting seems alltogether more professional and more believable at every level. Ritchie shows more flashes of inventiveness, and with an amazing finale, Snatch will undoubtedly stand on its own merits rather than being dismissed as formaliac under-performance from all involved.

reviews.review_title: Lock, Stock and a big diamond.
reviews.content: Snatch is a good film but is not much different from Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels.  Bullet-tooth Tony is Big Chris practically no change to the character.  Brad Pitt is very good as Mikey and Benicio del Toro is good as Frankie Four-fingers.  I kinda hoped for better from Guy Ritchie for a second film but who knows he might do better with his third although a break from a London-set gangster film might be in order.  And to the guy who thought the fight sequences were better than Fight Club, GET WITH IT, this film, good as it was, is not a patch on the excellent Fight Club.

When it comes to British gangster movies it seems that Guy Ritchie might as well take the cake, with two superb movies under his belt, Lock stock and two smoking barrels and Snatch. It is hard to find a movie that is as enjoyable as this. Its humor and tasteful violence brilliantly mixed into one that more than quenches the feeling that Guy Rithcie is more than just a one hit wonder.

Rarely, if ever have I left a theater with a smile that big, and that unerasable from my face. Hands down the coolest and most entertaining movie of the year. Wonderful characters, absolutely hilarious and fast as is gets. The opening credits had me gasping for air. And it only cost six million dollars. That's spec

reviews.review_title: E-X-C-E-L-L-E-N-T-!! (did I wrote it right?? I hope so..)
reviews.content: SNATCH. Ohh, I love that word... Why? I just love that movie!! It was SO GREAT!! I mean EXCELLENT. I just love it. I've seen it so many times (about 15 or something...) but I can watch always all over again. I don't know what is the "something" in that movie. Maybe it's the great actors (like the charming Brad Pitt or my favorite Benicio Del Toro, Ohh I just love them all!!)... Or is it Guy Ritchie (his SO GREAT!!)? Maybe it's the music (I want that soundtrack NOW!!!) or then it's just just EVERYTHING in that movie!! Anyway, I loved the story of it. I can't describe it, and that's because of my SO GREAT English speaking (I'm not that bad, or am I??). I want to thank especially Guy Ritchie for makin' this Fabulous movie!! THANK YOU! And of course I wanna thank the so special ACTORS!!! THank You... I hope that someday there comes "SNaTCH 2" or something like that!! Okay, I'll shut up now... (But I shall return!!)... XD!! :))!! love ya xxx -BROWNIe-

one of the top 3 films i've seen this year. very funny, very fast paced - an excellent follow up to 'lock, stock...' in my opinion. good performances by brad pitt, vinnie jones and especially alan ford as 'brick top'. u should definitely go see this film on a friday night with your mates.9.5/10

If you've seen ``Lock Stock & Two Smoking Barrels", you have absolutely no reason to see ``Snatch"; ``Lock Stock ..." did everything that ``Snatch" does, but did it better.The premise and structure are basically the same: in ``Lock Stock ..." the protagonists lost a lot of money at cards; here, there's a diamond at stake. In ``Lock Stock ..." there were a lot of thug Scotsmen with impenetrable accents; here, there are a lot of thug Scotsmen with impenetrable accents, plus Brad Pitt's gypsy character with an even less penetrable accent.  In ``Lock Stock ..." there was Hatchet Harry, a big, scary, violent man who held the gamblers' lives in his hands; in this movie there's an unlicensed-boxing bookie who tries to be as scary, but doesn't pull it off nearly as well as Hatchet Harry did.  And without revealing anything, the climaxes are exactly the same in both movies.Only ``Snatch" is less well done than ``Lock Stock ...".  There was something nicely unreal about ``Lock Stock ..." -- the camera tricks like slowing down and speeding up time, the vaguely sepia-toned film stock, and so on -- but you just felt you were watching reality through a lens. Clearly Guy Ritchie is trying to bring unreality to ``Snatch", but it comes off as more comical than ``Lock Stock ...".  Not ``comical" in the sense of funny -- ``comical" in the sense that you feel you're reading a comic book rather than watching a movie.  In the same vein, ``Snatch"'s pacing is too MTV: too jarring, not enjoyable.  This movie is very hard to digest.And if you've seen ``Lock Stock and Two Smoking Barrels", you can save the $8 and stay home without missing anything.

reviews.review_title: That dog....it had me in stitches!!
reviews.content: I saw Lock, Stock when it first came out, and loved it, I knew it would be huge because of the love of gangster films flockin about at the time.When I went to see Snatch I was not expecting it to be that good, I thought it would be too close to Lock, Stock and everyone had already started to refer to it as a sequel, when it is clearly not.Snatch centres around a few people, but the narrator is an illegal boxing promoter called Turkish, who gets into trouble when his boxer is knocked out by an indecipherable Irish guy called Mickey, who is played brilliantly by Brad Pitt.There are alot of things going on here, but the good thing about this film is that they all get tied up and twisted around each other at the end, so there are no loose ends.I was surprised at the performance of Brad Pitt,  he's a bit too mainstream for me, but in this film his acting and accent are superb. The only bit I didn't like involving him is when he stares into the flames, that is a bit too much like a hollywood blockbuster scene.Anyway, overall I loved this film. Oh and the dog I mentioned, watch out for it, its soooooo funny!I give this film 9 out of 10

First off, let me state that the first time I saw Pulp Fiction, I thought it was "okay" (I later upgraded my opinion to "very good", but that's beside the point). I didn't think Reservoir Dogs was all that fabulous.But I am a sucker for a good caper flick, and Snatch was that.There were moments when it seemed like Snatch was straining, or trying too hard, but it succeeded in being good, stylish, fast, furious, and above all FUNNY. Even the moments when it seemed Richie was trying too hard managed to be witty and make me (as well as the rest of the audience) laugh. As a matter of fact, I haven't been in a theater where the audience was this spellbound in the past year++, and I haven't been to a movie that I haven't been able to preguess within the first 15 minutes in a very long while. That's the first thing you might realize about Snatch, after the credits start rolling -- it sneaks up on you -- you don't even realize that you haven't even TRIED to think about how it's going to end -- it just flies too fast, and too furious. It's no Usual Suspects, but it isn't trying to be. It earns a solid 8.5 in my book. See this movie. (And for those who are reading this while it is in the theaters, spend your money on this flick -- don't let Save the Last Dance, which is pure schlock, blow this one away in the earnings war).

reviews.review_title: A fun, hilarious, and clever flick not to be overlooked.
reviews.content: First of all, don't make the mistake of labelling Snatch as the British Pulp Fiction.  Pulp Fiction and Snatch have nothing in common.  Pulp fiction rejuvaneted the crime genre in 94', so don't expect Snatch to do the same. Make no mistake, Snatch is an excellent film, yet it makes no attempts to hide what it is: a quick fun film.If not evident from his previous film, Lock Stock and Two Smoking Barrels, Guy Ritchie is a director to watch.  Snatch is a slickly made film from beginning to end.  The spinning, freezing, zooming camera shots create a style distinctive to Ritchie.  If anything, Snatch is fun to look at.What really makes the film shine is the meandering and interweaving plotlines of the various characters.  Snatch manages to create numerous hilarious situations out of your standard steal the diamond bit.  The movie never slows down and will have you captivated from beginning to end.The number of colorful and varied characters make for fun dialogue, and accents.  Brad Pitt is hilarious and totally convincing.  Again, don't go in with any pre judgements (i.e. the a fight club mind set).  His role in Snatch eclipses that of Tyler Durden.  It would be futile to describe the rest of the excellent cast.  Oh, and then there's the dog (worth the price of admission alone).  Ritchie takes every chance he gets to poke fun at anything and everything, and it works splendidly.Snatch, though not wholly original is a gem.  Don't listen to the comparison to Pulp Fiction, just watch it and have a blast with this expertly crafted and slickly made film.  Nine out of Ten.

reviews.review_title: best movie i've seen in a while
reviews.content: this movie is great it has everything from laughs to action .Something you should definitely rent . Brad Pitt's performance in this is amazing and masters the dialect(even though noone could make him out)I believe that this is one of the best movies ever made. Benicio del toro also gives a great amish impersonation. Guy Ritchie made two great and similar movies with Lock Stock and Two Smoking Barrels. A sequel to this movie would be great hopefully we will see one sometime soon. Boris the bulletdodger is the funniest of them all in him unwillingness to die definitely a must see if you already haven't and also i recommend Lock Stock and Two Smoking Barrels they are both similar movies

Now, don't get me wrong this is a good film standing on it's own. However a film that is not a standard sequel should not be so similar to it's predecessor (Lock Stock) that you feel throughout watching the whole thing. One hour and forty minutes of cockney accents, heists gone wrong, crosses, double crosses, triple crosses, Ad Nauseum; Roles seemingly created for whichever celebrity cockney they could find. They all sparkle of a director whose first time film was an original gem, running out of ideas.

This is just about the worst movie I've seen in a while!! The movie tries desperately to be funny but fails miserably. The plots maintain themselves throughout the movie until they cross in a way that is just plain stupid.The movie tries to be many things at once: a gangster movie/ a comedy/ and an action movie, but doesn't achieve any of them. The only character that was amusing was a dog sadly. Just save your $8 and go see something else.

Being one of the legion of fans of Lock Stock & Two Smoking Barrels, I obviously had quite an expectation for Guy Ritchie's second film, Snatch. Having read reviews for Snatch prior to seeing it, I expected to see Lock Stock version two.  However, I was very pleasantly surprised to see that this was not the case. Snatch is a brilliant standalone film that is visually amazing from start to finish.  Sometimes the case is with visually spectacular films that the characters/story lines aren't developed properly, but Guy Ritchie is just as good at dialogue as he is a director.  In a way Snatch improves on Lock Stock's only flaw - the acting.  Lock Stock was restrained financially, so they were forced to use second-rate actors with very little to no experience.  Snatch applies the familiarity and experience of actors such as Brad Pitt, Oscar winner Benicio Del Toro and Dennis Farina. Snatch is a visual and aural feast (Ritchie loves fast-paced music to match the action), and is well worth your while to view it. Snatch: 9/10

I can't put into words just how well this movie was made. I was originally surprised to see Brad Pitt in it because at first it seemed like a B movie at a time when Fight Club's popularity was through the roof. The acting done by all the actors in this movie are superb. The directing is superb. The sound...superb. The plot...outstanding. I must say that whoever wrote this movie sure is a funny guy because there are lines in this movie that i would never had thought of in a million years. The only bad thing i noticed about Snatch was it's partial leaving out of important information. So on a scale of -10 to 10...i give Snatch a -5 for the info thing, and plus several million for everything else.
Over cramped with characters going at tangents to each other. Avoid.

Here's a movie that doesn't let up for the whole 90 minutes. Apparently the first cut was 3 hours long, so Guy Ritchie cut out every frame that did not advance the storyline. The result is fast, furious and four letter word-ing funny. As with his debut film "Lock, Stock..." it features a collection of "large" London criminal types whose paths criss-cross chasing a significant illegal prize, in this case a stolen diamond.Oh, and the DVD is worth buying for the director's commentary alone.

reviews.review_title: Fast-paced, never dull, an excellent film
reviews.content: This movie was excellent through and through. It never stopped being interesting. You never knew what was coming next. It was funny, tense, exciting and just plain terrific. I disagree with other commenters that Pitt stole the show: no one stole it. Every actor contributed just the right amount. They were all great. There was so much going on here that it grabbed and held my attention the whole time. I didn't want it to end either, but since it had to, I can think of no better ending than the one it had. A great film.

I watched the DVD yesterday. Somebody had told me that this was a good movie. But I don't agree... it's brilliant! Wonderful story with lots of surprises, great acting, lots of laughs. Okay, there is rather a lot of violence in this film, but it's not too gruesome. I really enjoyed this film.

The simple concept of underworlders all chasing after a diamond is turned by Ritchie into a brilliant vortex of coincidence, violence and black humour. The paths of the factions has been excellently contrived, and its nice to see that it doesn't take itself seriously. If you don't either, then it's a top notch way to kill a few hours.

reviews.review_title: Snatch is a story in the telling
reviews.content: Snatch is like a novel. Guy Ritchie handles scenes like simultaneous events in a Michael Crichton, or CLive Cussler novel linking them together as the story unfolds. Watch it for superb performances by Pitt and the rest. And most of all , this is a film where you can see the 'direction' Amazing. Oh. Watch it withe the subtitles.

reviews.review_title: One of the greatest movies for me
reviews.content: Snatch is a movie from the year 2000 directed and written by Guy Richie. The movie is about Irish gangsters, hit men,jewel thieves, and a gypsy boxer. Some of the stars in the film are Jason Statham as Turkish, Brad Pitt as Mickey, Alan Ford as Brick Top, and Benicio Del Toro as Franky Four Fingers. Turkish and his sidekick Tommy get themselves into many altercations with their gangster boss Brick Top. One of the most interesting altercations is when they get involved with a bare knuckle boxer by the name of Mickey. The movie follows their attempts to survive as earned boys. The theme of this movie is survival in the underground world. Turkish and Tommy make many mistakes in this movie which pushes them further and further into the underground life. I really enjoy how the director lightens the mood of these mistakes with humor. Turkish and Tommy have exceptional chemistry when it comes to disagreeing or making fun of each other. This chemistry is what kept me so involved in the movie. While there is plenty of comedy the two also display plenty of serious when death is involved. The music in the film adds depth and increases the overall entertainment value. There are plenty of scenes that would have been good without the music, but when then music is added the scene becomes breath taking. In the beginning of the movie where Mickey challenges Gorgeous George to a bare knuckle fight is a good example of this. Without the music the scene would have been just like any other bare knuckle fight scene. With the addition of music and slow motion the scene comes to life.Another great aspect of this movie is how it had multiple plots but still maintained to satisfy your interests with each of them. You would think that one or two plots would be hard enough to properly portray. Snatch properly portrays at least 5. Following the diamond, an unlicensed boxing promoters, a bare knuckle boxer, an Irish gangster, and a confused timid sidekick is not a easy task. Guy Ritchie does an exceptional job of explaining each in great detail in 104 minutes.Snatch is one of my favorite movies of all times. I really enjoy knowing that I only knew one actor in this movie. I did not know the director or the writer or any other actors for this matter. This movie has an completely unbiased review from me. Yet it remains to be in my top 5 all time list of greatest movies.

Here is a movie I never cease to enjoy, the colorful characters, wittiest dialog ever and winding plot are the best. I wish Guy Ritchie would make more films like this, I know others have attempted, but few come close. Although Lock Stock and Two Smoking Barrels is fantastic as well. I was steered away from the film because of the title, but once you watch it, you'll understand why the name. Brad Pitt's performance is one of his best albeit a small role, and this breakout role for Jason Statham is the reason he is a major star today. There are other great characters like Bullet Tooth Tony by Vinnie Jones and other characters that will be hard to forget. I think if I could wear out a DVD, this is one that has been put through the paces. Anyone who has seen this is likely to have seen it a few times, and if you are 'movie guy' can likely quote at least 10-20 lines from the rich dialog.

reviews.review_title: One of my go to favorites
reviews.content: I can't believe any bad reviews. All time best script, directing and film editing. Wow. How can anyone watch this film and then say Guy Ritchie can't direct.

reviews.review_title: One of the best Black Farce films made
reviews.content: Guy Ritchie's `Snatch', is a hilarious look into the world of a small known `businessman' and his partner, slugging it out with a big-time criminal mastermind who always gets his way.  This compelling new age flick, has all the right ingredients to what makes a great, black farce film, which is exactly what it is. The story starts with the robbery of an eighty-six carat diamond.  This leads to the introduction of some of Britain's underground gangsters.  The hunt for the diamond is on, with a little illegal boxing, gambling and a bunch of Pikeys (Gypsies) on the side.  As you watch the multi-plot structures, and the movies black humour combine, you will be truly fascinating by the way the characters handle such occurrences. Unlike one of Ritchie's famous movie ` Lock, Stock and two smoking barrels,' Snatch's editing changes from character to character, updating the sub-narrative threads that take place.  The frantic paced camerawork enables the audience to feel enthralled in the movies twists and turns. A range of characters in the movie intersect theirs paths with others. This leads to the sub-narrative threads being linked together into a firm ball of fun and laughter.  Through the inclusion of devices such as split screens and a '1980's British Pop' sounding soundtrack, Ritchie has managed to incorporated sequences including decades of cinematic style and cultural differences. Although it is hard to pin point a particular character to take the part of the main, from an observer's point of view it would be Turkish (Jason Statham) and his side kick Tommy (Stephen Graham).  Some of the best scenes in the movie are  between the strained relationship of Turkish and Tommy as they try to avoid becoming a meal for the pigs. At the same time, Turkish is trying to control the unpredictable Pickey, Mickey (Brad Pitt) to do as he is told.  As the story unravels, it takes twists and turn that prove to be lethal and leave you praying that you are never faced with a similar situation. Throughout the movie, there is a large array of characters with some of Hollywood's most famous faces such as Brad Pitt and Denis Farina, and some not so famous faces, Jason Statham behind them. There are also many outstanding performances from other cast members such as Mike Reid as Doug and Robbie Gee as Vinny.  However, in general, you would not find a movie with a better overall performance. Ritchie's endless energy in this film makes `Snatch' a must see.  One hundred and three minutes of twists and turns that will leave you wanting to watch it repeatedly, incase you missed any of the minor details.  A movie that has made its mark for incredible acting, and insightful directing. 9/10

reviews.review_title: Guy has obviously a passion for these fast and energetic films, so don't expect any different from him, the question really is, are they really any good?
reviews.content:
Guy Ritchie's Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels, and Snatch, are almost completely identical films, (except maybe in the lengths of the titles) but they use the same narrative styles, storylines, themes and even characters. Guy has obviously a passion for these fast and energetic films, so don't expect any different from him, the question really is, are they really any good?The film 'Snatch' is based around a group of London's underground gangsters, criminals and mobs. Three individual storylines meet and part, only to meet again, and then part again, combined with excessively fast cuts and sequences this makes the storyline difficult to digest for the average audience member the first time round. These set of gangsters; however all are in it for the same thing, in some way or another, a diamond which is a big as a small fist. These are also linked to a group of sub-plots which weave into the storylines of the different groups in the movie. Creating a well defined storyline, although this for most of the film will leave the audience slightly disorientated. Of course because of films Black comic nature, half the characters are the same way.The editing style used in Snatch ranges from incredibly fast cuts and sequences, to slow and long dialogue's between characters, including a long monologue of the 'usefulness' of a pig's digestive system. Just because the film is in English, doesn't mean that we have gotten over the language barrier with international film yet, while the accent is much more understandable there are some characters who it seems even other characters can't even understand, an example being Mickey (Brad Pitt) who speaks in his own dialect only few have mastered. Overall the storyline is complicated to a degree that it makes the film unpredictable yet still understandable (well, maybe on the second viewing)The script is an interesting component of the movie as it creates some interesting characters, Avi (Dennis Farina), an American business man being only one example. However the storyline seems to cut in and out of storylines, characters and times too quickly, the beginning of the movie seems to introduce the characters too quickly then dumps you into the middle of the story. It takes some time for the audience to catch up with each of the groups within the story and figure out how each are related. By the end of the film the audience has just got to know the characters, and aren't really concerned for them by the time they make their 'exit,' let alone relate to any of them, although this would be an impossible task for any realistic person anyway. The characters are interesting and dynamic, but when it comes down to it not real and believable. However I agree with Roger Ebert in that: `.no movie can be all bad that contains the following dialogue:U.S. Customs official: 'Anything to declare?' Avi (Dennis Farina): 'Yeah. Don't go to England.' Roger Ebert (See Bibliography)
Guy Ritchie's 'Lock Stock and Two Smoking Barrels' follows a similar formula so those who enjoyed 'Lock Stock and Two Smoking Barrels' will most likely enjoy Snatch. However I feel this film was let down by an undeveloped and erratic plot. Ben Waugh

Snatch Review In 1998 Guy Ritchie released his amusing view of the British Underworld called Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels.  Now he's gone one step further with Snatch, which was one of the funniest movies I saw in 2000.  With an all-star cast this movie will have you laughing until you cry.  It is black comedy at it's very best. Starting in Antwerp, a man by the name of Frankie Four Fingers (Benicio Del Toro) holds up a diamond dealer and gets his hands, or all nine fingers if you will, on very large diamonds.  He then takes those diamonds to London and arranges a meeting with Doug the Head (Mike Reid), a Jewish diamond dealer. Meanwhile Franky wants a gun, so he goes to Boris (Rade Serbedzija).  In exchange for the gun, Boris sends Franky to the bookies to put money on an illegal boxing match.  This is a set up as the bookies are to be robbed by two pathetic, black porn brokers.  The plot now becomes very complex as the local crime boss Brick Top (Alan Ford) has been promised by the promoters Turkish (Jason Statham) and Tommy (Stephan Graham) that they will put up a fighter.  The contestant, unfortunately, is hospitalised by a bare-knuckle gypsy-boxing champion.  Meanwhile, the largest diamond is lost and everybody wants to find it including an American diamond dealer.  Sound simple enough? Describing this complicated plot is not easy because it is so intertwined. In addition, I don't want to give away the very amusing scenarios. The experienced and talented cast includes Jason Statham (The Transporter) as the sarcastic fight organiser called Turkish.  Alan Ford is the notorious crime boss, Brick Top and Brad Pitt (Fight Club) as Mickey O'Neil, the bare-knuckle boxing champion.  Vinnie Jones (Mean Machine) plays hard man Bullet Tooth Tony and Benicio Del Toro, who later wins an Oscar for Traffic, is Franky Four Fingers, a man with a gambling problem.  Dennis Farina (Get Shorty) is the impatient American diamond dealer Cousin Abraham 'Avi' Denovitz.  Rade Serbedzija (The Quiet American) as the 'hard to kill' ex KGB Boris The Blade/Bulletdodger.  Jason Flemyng (The League of Extraordinary Gentlemen) as Mickey's best friend Darren.  These actors play their parts so well that you feel that you are part of this underground criminal culture. The nicknames are so descriptive of each of the characters. Directed by Guy Ritchie, this film seems like a sequel to Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels.  The style and feeling is almost exactly the same. The way in which he weaves separate stories together as though they are viewed from different angles.  Since he is an English director he uses the typical Cockney slang that's common in the backstreets of London.  The script is very clever in the terms of how much that slang is being used and although one may not be familia with the expressions it can be easily understood from the context. The opening sequence is ingenious.  It moves from one person to another showing us who they are and what they do.  It also shows us how all of these people are connected and sets the scene for the interesting plot that follows. As much as I loved Guy's first instalment this is by far the funnier of the two.  Not only are the characters famous internationally but also they each play their parts to perfection reflecting their characters.  The result is incredibly funny and well mixed. Rating:  5/5 Stars

This is one of the best movies ever. Every dialog in this movie is a classic one. I know the entire film by heart. It is a master piece, not much more to say about it. Guy Ritchie is an awesome writer and director. And who would believe that an old football player like Vinnie Jones could play such a perfect role?

As with the output of Danny Boyle one had suspicions that the praise piled on Ritchie as the saviour of the British film industry might be a blind to his fundamental inability to find an interesting story to tell. I am not a fan of Dicaneo's Full Monty schtick or Billy Eliott either but they do create some sense of scene. Snatch portrays London as a back lot in west London populated by media studies references to Tarantino, just as you would expect from an Old Harovian. Watch this after Lock, Stock and followed by Swept Away and Ritchie's downward trajectory becomes clear.

reviews.review_title: A Witty Film For Those England Lovers!
reviews.content: An amazingly made film, about comedy, teamwork, and utter crime. I could not believe my eyes when I first watched this movie. It brought out so much inspiration for the young wannabe filmmaker, but may I forewarn you, it isn't for the faint of heart when it comes to comedy and blood. I have always loved British films, BBC Charles Dickens, Jane Austen etc. ever since I was a kid. But Guy Ritchie is one of the most astonishing English Directors of the 21st century in my vast opinion."Snatch" a brilliant story about how gluts and criminals fight over the goods. A mere diamond, stolen by criminals disguised as Jews brings a wide range of characters into a subject of mystery, death, friendship, and most important of all, money. Brad Pitt's acting is phenomenal and the dialog is hysterically astounding. My eyes widened as the plot got thicker and thicker. It drove me over the edge of happiness and enthusiasm to the point to where I fell into a pool of laughter and cunning only to which, I had to be "snatched" back into reality. 5 Stars!

Snatch is a brilliant, violent but often hilariously funny thriller about the lives of a gang of London low lives, as well as Americans, Irish travellers, Russians and the tough and shady world of underground boxing. I remember the film first causing a stir because of the casting of Brad Pitt against type as a rough Irish traveller and his supposedly incomprehensible accent. Pitt is brilliant as he hams it up but never goes overboard is a role that is a slight parody of his part in Fight Club. As with Lock Stock....Guy Ritchie keeps his cast of favourites and it shows, the acting is excellent from just about all concerned. Although for me as with Lock Stock.....it's Vinnie Jones who steals every scene he's in as the violent and menacing Bullet Tooth Tony. Alan Ford is also fantastic as the sly and shady Brick Top. Ritchie's assured direction never skips a beat, and his trademark camera-work is again on display, and editing techniques are second to none. Also the characters are wonderful and the script is first rate. The central plot is as old as the hills - criminals try to retrieve a diamond stolen from an Antwerp jewellers - but it doesn't matter. This is one the true gems of British cinema.

Guy Ritchie's film "Snatch" has been one of the most interesting movies that I've seen in a while, to say the least. Written and directed by Ritchie himself, the movie had two major actors that I was familiar with off the bat; Brad Pitt and Jason Statham. Released in 2000, this film tells many different stories at the same time through the use of creative cinematography and storytelling elements. We follow the story of two unlicensed boxing promoters as they're ensnared in the underworld of diamond dealing. Throughout the movie, they come in contact with various characters such as "Frankie 'Four Fingers'" and "Boris 'The Blade'". As the movie progresses, our characters stories intertwine, until their paths coalesce into a single plot, involving all the different characters introduced throughout the film. I would recommend this movie for anyone that enjoys thrillers and action films.

Quite possibly my favourite film. I've watched it at least a dozen times and I'm sure ill watch it a dozen more! There was still little clever parts i don't think i noticed until my 3rd or 4th viewing! Like when 'bullet tooth tony' orders a beer in the bar, the barman only gets halfway through pouring it when he sees 3 men come in with masks and guns, and ducks down behind the bar. Tony picks up the pint, looks at it funny and drinks it anyway.I love the characters in this film as well. Turkish and tommy are great together but my favourite duo is Vincent and Solomon. they are hardly the brightest criminal duo and when you add Tyrone in to the mix with them, they are just hilarious. The scene where they rob the bookies is one of my favourite of all time.Last thing id like to comment about this film is the amazing soundtrack! If i didn't already have them i made sure i downloaded every song after watching this film!

reviews.review_title: Do not miss out on this good time.
reviews.content: Turkish (Jason Statham), Tommy (Stephen Graham), Brick Top (Alan Ford), Bullet Tooth Tony (Vinnie Jones), Boris The Blade (Rade Serbedzija), Sol (Lennie James), Vinny (Robbie Gee), Tyrone (Ade), Gorgeous George (Adam Fogerty), Frankie Four Fingers (Benicio del Toro), Cousin Avi Denovitz and the list goes on. If that gaggle of unique character names and cast members does not spark your movie watching interest I don't know what will. These characters are just part of the many great elements that make up the movie "Snatch"; which landed the 100th spot on the "IMDb top 250" movies list.With a plot focused theme, this comedy/thriller takes us on an outing full of hilarious mischief, and it plays off the popular saying "trust no one". Fast paced and full of plot twist, we watch the main character Turkish become involuntarily involved in troublesome predicaments. Turkish and Tommy have their hands full trying to pay off a debt owed to the gangster Brick Top due to a boxing bet gone bad, because Mickey (their unruly prize fighter) not being able to follow directions. At the same time, we have the feud between Boris and Cousin Avi Denovtiz over a diamond heist performed by Frankie Four Fingers whom worked for Avi and was set up to be robbed by Boris. Boris the Blade's reputation for violence requires Avi to hire the hit-man Bullet Tooth Tony to help him retrieve his stolen diamond. Although Avi hired an able body to complete his task, Boris was not so fortunate when he hired the incapable Sol, Vinny and Tyrone to steal the stone from Frankie Four Fingers, and rob the bookies owned by the gangster Brick Top. Brick Top in turn puts on a search to find the 3 who attempted to rob his establishment, and they in turn give Brick Top knowledge of the diamond which he sends them to retrieve to avoid death. Whew! That's a lot going on. So, after many bullets fly, and hysterical interactions take place the movie comes full circle, and we end with the main character/narrator Turkish on top with the diamond, alongside his friend Tommy. "Snatch" is riddled with jump-cuts, witty fast paced dialogue, and subjective camera angles that help the audience stay interested, and feel like part of the film. Every scene plays into the plot, and any unneeded story/scenes are left out of the film. So, it is important for viewers to be attentive while watching the film or you will be sure to miss amusing conversations, and key moments. The angles help you engage in the conversation as they seem to be in first person view and the cut back and forth between the characters. Guy Richie used the same style and plot driven theme in his other film "Locked, Stocked, and Two Smoking Barrels". We also see some of the same actors such as Jason Statham and Vinnie Jones in this film too, but it was missing Brad Pitt who puts on a noteworthy performance as Mickey in "Snatch". Though quite comical Snatch is most certainly an adult film. Although some parts of the movie can be considered grisly, it still manages to put a funny spin on murder, and deception (I know that sounds a little crazy). Between a botched robbery, which included a getaway driver who can barely fit in his own car, Brick Top's passion for pigs, and Bullet Tooth Tony's different but effective way of handling his victims, you will get a fair share of laughing at illegal activities.If you are a person who loves movies that are plot driven, fast paced, and packed with charismatic dialogue be sure to watch "Snatch" when you get a chance. This movie will not disappoint.

reviews.review_title: Brilliant! Guy Ritchie at his best!!
reviews.content: Snatch is a typical story about gangsters and people trying to get hold of a diamond. What makes it special is the direction of Guy Ritchie & the performances by the cast. Franky Four Fingers, Turkish, Mickey, Cousin Avi, Tommy, all of them, are great characters. Most of the film is taken in a very comical way. The songs played in the background are really with the mood and is perfect! Slow motion scenes and action sequences are really well taken by Ritchie. One of the best movies of Guy Ritchie (Like "Lock Stock and Two Smoking Barrels). This movie is a must watch. Go for it."ANYTHING TO DECLARE? YEAH! DON'T GO TO ENGLAND!"

reviews.review_title: Very South East London gangster reality!
reviews.content: Following Lock Stock and Two Smoking Barrels would have been no easy task without the input of Brad Pitt. However he obviously saw the potential of this film and, I believe, offered his services for next to nothing. Having said that it was an enormous risk to star an American actor in the role of such a strangely particular person as "The Pikey" and I am so impressed with Richie's bravery and Pitt's abilities. The editing of the film is such an incredibly cohesive representation of the reality it seeks to portray. The violent and comically black survival humor it depicts, along with the adrenaline rush of street lunacy it encompasses was and is about as accurate as you can get. Life as it is for those who want to be upwardly mobile at the hard end of London. What's more I am a Pikey!The only caveat would be, subtitles for the rest of the Planet.

This is without a doubt, one of my all time top 10 movies! The script along with the cast to deliver it with impeccable timing and conviction has made me watch this movie time and again with the same enthusiasm and euphoria! Great cast of British actors with a young Stephen Graham is a winner 9/10

reviews.review_title: Crime comedy from a fresh perspective
reviews.content: I must first admit that I've seen this film close to 20 times. I never get tired of seeing it (I'm starting to understand pikey!!). The characters are memorable, the script un-Hollywood, the humour sharp, and the directorial genius of Guy Ritchie is evident. There are slow motion shots, split-screens, and all kinds of other orthodox film-making techniques. These, together with beautifully written dialogues, great performances (Especially Del Toro, Farina, Ford, Pitt, Graham....I could go on forever), and the great integration of different story lines come together to make one helluva flick. Well done Mr Ritchie (or is that Mr Madonna??? heck, I'll just call you Susan if you want!) Having seen both Lock, stock....and Snatch, I'd say snatch just takes it at the finish, literally.
Way too frikin complicated too many plot twists and acting isn't great either

reviews.review_title: Fantastic plot pieces brilliantly put together made this movie even better than pulp fiction
reviews.content: Man, this is one from the category "I couldn't stop watching it over and over..." If you liked Pulp fiction, you're gonna simply worship this movie. Not only that it provides constant fun and excitement throughout the entire movie but it also provides you with such memorable characters that you'll never forget. Starting from Turkish, leading to Brickface and so on... Mixture of different, sometimes laughable and amusing, sometimes of unexpectedly cruel nature, sometimes both of this, time & space scenes, fantastically put together so that your eye won't look to another direction for not even a second of this film. To all of you who enjoy a good action full of unexpected events and turnouts this is a must-see. O yeah, if you remembered Guy Ritchie as "the English bloke who married Madonna", after you see this movie you' re gonna ask yourself: "What's the name of that pop singer married to Guy Ritchie?"

reviews.review_title: Absolutely flash film from Guy Ritchie!
reviews.content: First off, I can't believe this kooky $3-million movie came to our local cinemas, we usually only get the $100-mil blockbusters.  I saw it twice in the theaters and bought the DVD as soon as I saw it.  This is the kind of quirky, dangerous, offbeat humor the intelligent moviegoer can really sink his teeth into; toss in a couple of characters you care about, a couple of characters you really want to see get hurt, a storyline you don't expect, and add some way flash dialogue.  The musical choices made for this movie are perfect; I downloaded a couple of singles from the soundtrack and then just went out and bought the cd.  If you enjoyed Get Shorty, Pulp Fiction, or Lock, Stock & Two Smoking Barrels, do not wait one more minute: you must go now and rent this film.  After this and Lock Stock I can't wait to see what writer/director Ritchie comes up with next.

Snatch the new film by Guy Ritchie is a mainstream masterpiece. And without doubt the best movie, not to mention most descent move of the year. Almost all movies this year thus far have been complete c**p. All hype and not living up to its word, something which Hollywood is fond of. However Snatch rises above all that jargon and comes out as a sly comedy that is well acted and even better written. I came into the theater and kept telling myself that this wasn't a direct sequel (although it did use most of the same actors from Lock Stock) and to watch it as if I never knew Guy Ritchie's work, and it worked. But some viewers might find this hard due to the fact that Lock Stock was such a good movie, which it was. But in my opinion this was better. The movie itself is very high paced and fun. So if you live in the U.K and have a hole burning in your pocket, go see Snatch. Your pocket and your head will thank you.

reviews.review_title: Lock, Stock and Smoking barrels the sequel
reviews.content: Same plot and story line as his (Guy Ritchies) last movie, Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels. If you enjoyed that movie you will enjoy this one. It's entertaining, but there is nothing new or different about it. There were times when it was really hard to understand what the characters were saying.

reviews.review_title: Good. But too much like Lock Stock
reviews.content: Snatch is a good film, I liked it. But whilst watching it you can't help but feel that you're seeing an alternate version of Lock Stock and Two Smoking Barrels. Vinnie is playing the same character. The plot is based around a bunch of people trying to obtain something for an gangster boss in exchange for their lives. Similar sorts of comic situations. Etc.I personally felt that the "original" was funnier, better directed, and with a better balance of characters. Although Snatch is a good film, I would have enjoyed it more if I hadn't spent much of it feeling I'd seen it all before.

snatch...OOooh a masterpiece of a movie. Guy Ritchie is an excellent director and writer..his former masterpiece Lock,stock and two smoking barrels just blew the roof and was to become one of my favourite movies but now he suprises me again with Snatch ,a movie wich was Lock,stock.. times two. Snatch involves superb character's and cool names. It's several histories wich is connected around this one item, a huge diamond. All the seperated histories meets in the end and it's just excellent.

Guy Ritchie's new film Snatch is a deal, it's steal, it's Sale of the Fu#!ing Century. With plot twists in every new scene and countless amount of characters. This movie is a piece of classic comedy. And not corny U.S. comedy or Yabbo Australian comedy. I'm talking up front smart England Comedy.Guy Ritchie really shines in the criminal underworld of England genre making almost every thing said in his movies funny. I being a big fan of Lock, Stock and 2 Smoking Barrels I built up a lot of anticpation for this movie. Though not as good as Lock, Stock, Snatch certainly lived up to my expectations and I must say is outstanding work.Snatch has two seperate plot lines which managed to be pulled into each other. Mostly thanks to one awesome dog that swallows, not spits. See this movie and you will not be disappointed

reviews.review_title: Now that was worth 10 bucks !! (18 with soda and popcorn)
reviews.content: It has been rare that I have walked out of a movie theater and was pleased. Guy Ritchie is able to keep the pace fast and moving at all times.  I would have given it a 10 if it weren't for the 'ard to 'ear accents.It is such a well done ensemble cast that not one character overtakes another (particularly with stars Brad Pitt and Dennis Farina.  The humor is witty and at times very understated but enough to make you laugh out loud (many many times).With all the crap that is churned out of Hollywood, it is refreshing to see a film that comes across as though it was crafted by professionals who love their work more than making money.GO SEE IT !!!!!

reviews.review_title: I've never seen a Snatch as great as this
reviews.content: This is a fantastic film and easily ranks along with Lock Stock and two smoking barrels. For all the similar traits between the two films they are both very different.Snatch brings a much more serious slant on the London gangster scene, with more menacing characters. The film however retains a great deal of humour and sideways slant at violence and crime.The dialogue is very sharp and Brad Pitt character is a masterstroke - employing one of the most sought after actors in hollywood to play an irish, illegal boxing gippo.Richie must carry on his rise to stardom, by picking his next film carefully and steering clear of another london gangster flick or casting his wife.

reviews.review_title: Brad Pitt is no pretty boy anymore, and he keeps that trend going
reviews.content: This movie was bad-ass.  The acting was incredible, and the stories were great.  The fact that a movie can make you laugh when people are dying only makes you see the movie in a greater light.  This movie had everything action, laughs, a fat guy with a British accent, a dog, a diamond...and oh yeah Brad Pitt.  Now I'm not saying that because i think Brad Pitt is hot, I'm not like that.  No I'm saying that because Brad Pitt is one of the best actors in Hollywood right now.  This is thanks to his departure from those sappy, Meet Joe Black type movies, and his roles in movies like Fight Club, and now Snatch.  He makes one of the best performances of his career and I'm glad it is in a good movie.  Everyone should see this movie and I garauntee you won't be disappointed .

A hugely enjoyable movie, from the opening scene of a 'jewish' Benicio Del Toro snatching the stone in a snappily-filmed armed heist, to It's denouement, Guy Richie's tale of a madcap hunt for a stolen diamond, is smart, sassy, in-your-face movie. The script is superb, and the cast make the most of it. Brad Pitt is a revelation an Irish, bareknuckle boxing gypsy, his thick and hilariously unintelligible Irish brogue leaves you wanting more, if you like your comedy sharp, fast, and relentless, then 'Snatch' is a must-see. Great work by Guy Richie, and an excellent follow-up to "Lock Stock and Two Smoking Barrels".

reviews.review_title: Guy Ritchie is a ONE-TRICK PONY!!!
reviews.content: Guy Ritchie is a one-trick pony.  However, that trick of his sure is entertaining.  Ritchie captures that same quirky spark of humor as seen in 'Lock, Stock, & Two Smoking Barrels' and puts it to work on his latest outing, 'Snatch'.The similarities between the two movies are quite evident, but the nuances of every scene are inventive enough to have equalled the highest expectations I'd held for it.Don't expect it to win any Oscars...but it is one of the few recent movies that is worth spending money to see.  A comic gem (no pun intended).

reviews.review_title: One of the coolest movies of the year...
reviews.content: After seeing the very short trailer, I definitely knew I needed to see this Guy Ritchie movie. Not because of the quality of the trailer, but simply because of all the names involved. Besides Guy Ritchie, almost the complete cast of Lock, Stock & Two Smoking Barrels plus Brad Pitt and Dennis Farina joined.This movie is funny, but more than funny. It'll make you laugh, but It'll also make you shiver with rage, and surprise you with the enormously original and fast-paced editing. But what struck me the most was that it's so full of cool things, you probably think you've seen more than one movie after leaving the cinema.Go and see this movie, but beware; men will like it more than women. But for me it was definitely one of the coolest movies of the last couple of years. It beat L, S & 2 S M, and almost any other movie of recent time...

reviews.review_title: Snatch was good, but Lock,Stock Was much better!
reviews.content: Now while Snatch was a good movie, I was disappointed that it was just a copy of Lock, Stock & Two Smoking Barrels. Lock, Stock is definetily the better movie by far, a completely original, very funny and amazing film. Snatch did have it's moments but was a very predictable movie especially if you've already seen Lock, Stock. I just hope Guy Ritchie's next film won't just be another copy of these 2 films!

reviews.review_title: Best Movie So Far This Year!
reviews.content: Last night I was lucky enough to get tickets to the sold out showing of "Snatch". I was blown away. Clever plot, excellent story, awesome cast and outstanding editing and DP work. I highly recommend this movie. 10 out of 10.

If this movie doesn't get an oscar for best movie of the year then they can close down the the academy awards!The people who wrote/made this and the guys that acted in it... THANK YOU, it was really an 84 carat movie!!

This movie is like Crouching Tiger and O,Brother in that it is impossible to describe these movies to friends looking for recommendations.  There is nothing to compare them to.
