You tell people what they're about, and they go yea that sounds interesting... I loved all three, but I doubt that anyone who's sought my counsel in such matters has seen any of them. This movie is the Three Stooges with real hammers and saws. This is Wile E. Coyote being run over by a semi and appearing in the next scene with a bandage on his forehead. Fearless Fosdick, The Movie. To steal an old Honeymooners line, this is two pounds of plot in a one-pound bag. This is what the nuns used to call a Chinese fire drill.
A great movie overall I love this movie one of my favourites, with its iconic quotes, great cinematography and memorable story line.

reviews.review_title: More of the same, but you can't complain about that
reviews.content: During one of the first scenes of Snatch, I got worried.  I was worried that Guy Ritchie was a fraud(well not so much a fraud as a fluke.)  While Franky Four Fingers and his crew were stealing the diamond in question, Ritchie utilized this cheesy camera technique of zooming in real fast while turning it at an angle, I looked like a bad music video, or someone trying to look like Guy ritchie, and it looked way to polished)not to be confuded with good)  Anyway, this turned out to be a misconception on my part, as the rest of the film blew me away.  Ritchie is certainly a talented, even revolutionary filmmaker. I keep hearing alot from critics about how his movies have too many characters, the plotlines are too convoluted.  I couldn't disagree more. Ritchie deftly rolls out story lines weaves them together, and keeps you guessing til the very end, all the while spewing out classic lines of dialogue.  His frenetic pace, although not at all traditional among the film community, is representative of modern pop culture, and works magnificently if only you let it. Anyway, I can't believe anyone would have a problem with being exposed to all these great characters anyway, Ritchie truly has a knack for creating awesome, fleshed-out and altogether sordid characters.  Even though some of the ones in Snatch were really just re-hashing of ones from Lock Stock, everyone has such an individual quality that makes them stand out on their own. Also, I really want to point out what a damn fine actor Alan Ford is, and that Brick Top is just about my favorite villain EVER.BludgeoN

Go see Lock, Stock & Two Smoking Barrels I know the idea was to build the box office, but why do we need American actors intruding into British film? Come on, Guy! Did you have to make another crazy-mixed-up crime comedy again. And what's with the comic book openings? There were some funny bits. After slugging through a very slow beginning. Jason Statham and Stephen Graham were perfect as Turkish and Tommy. The pawn shop guys (Lennie James, Robbie Gee, Ade) were funny together too. Though he has been good in many things, Dennis Farina was at his worst. And Brad Pitt, I'm sure he studied hard on that accent, but he is just not right for this film. And haven't we seen him get beat up before? I didn't walk out with many of the other patrons, but I was disappointed.

reviews.review_title: One of the most exciting and innovative movies I've ever seen.
reviews.content: Awesome movie!! Excellent story, visuals, casting, soundtrack, etc. etc. etc.!!! A must-see mind boggling adventure. This movie has made Brad Pitt, Vinnie Jones and Jason Statham my three new favorite actors. Guy Ritchie is a cinematic genius.

This film is unquestionably one of the best film of the last decade, many give that accolade to "Pulp Fiction" but this is better than anything Tarantino has come up with and Ritchie has a better ear for dialogue (and that's saying something). If people can get over the fact that this is set in cockney London and not cool L.A. than they'll agree with me. If your still unsure weather to watch it just watch it for the Pitt performance.

If the movie had been set in America, with all the characters American, and all the accents American, people would have screamed that "Snatch" is merely a "Pulp Fiction" ripoff. I guess giving people accents really does seem to add style and originality where there was none to begin with.

reviews.review_title: Snatch is a brilliant Directorial masterpiece from Guy Richie
reviews.content: This is my film of the year, after watching it once I coulden't get enough, Its a film you can watch more then once, in fact more then 10 times. The film is about a diamond, while a lot of storys are going on a once it all boils down to the one thing, The Diamond. Excellent performances by Brad Pitt, as well as everyone else, while a serious film it is a mix between comedy aswell with Sol, Vinny and Tyrone providing some great laughs. Now onto Guy Richie, he has made this film superb, the music is brilliant, the camera angles is great and the parts from introducting all the characters to the part where Avi comes to London. The boxing scenes are great especiailly at the end.What more can I say about Snatch??Great Film, Great Music, Great directing, Great actors, Great story, Great comedy, In general go and buy it and I gurantee personally you will not be disapointed. I give the film a Strong 9.5/10 and agree that it is much better then Lock Stock!Adaceg

reviews.review_title: Excellent comedy (funnier version of ANALYZE THIS)
reviews.content: In my expeience of movies this movie is the funniest movie i have ever seen. Eventhough i hate comedy movies this movie has single handedly changed my opinion. Its a must see for anyone who wishes to laugh till their nerve pops.

reviews.review_title: Packed! Must've been tough keeping the film as short as 104 minutes.
reviews.content: Definitely a film to buy for keeps! Unlike the movie "Unbreakable" (which I still maintain, should have been say 30 minutes long), this movie is packed with so much action. So much so that many scenes had to be in fast-forward, with others being omitted so that you the viewer can fill in obvious blanks. Like most sequels (if I may call it that), it borrows motifs from "Lock Stock". It however manages to remain original and (have I not mentioned yet?)very very interesting

So today I watched this movie Snatch, directed by Guy Ritchie. What an amazing movie!! A delight to watch; I mean I had heard that movie but this good.I had never expected.So the movie is basically about all these criminals trying to snatch things from each other. Story starts when a man named Franky Four Fingers smuggles an 84 carat diamond to London to sell to a jeweler on behalf of his boss. And then a lot of crooks and biggies get involved. And everyone is trying to snatch something from others; hence the name Snatch. Now this storyline may seem very familiar to you; and in a sense it shares some flavor with The Departed and Babel, but the real killer is the way story is told. I have got to give to Guy Ritchie. I mean what a comedy! The criminals in the movie are not white collar ones, they are the bums for whom crime, violence, theft, debauchery is a way of life. And each of them has his own idiosyncrasies; which ultimately screw him up at some point or another. And still all of them continue so nonchalantly through all the mess. And I just can't describe to you right now how great the way story is told is. One of the best I have ever seen. And the performances from all the characters are mind blowing. Especially the one from a character named Bullet Tooth. And as for me, it showed me the world in way I had never seen.So I would highly recommend this movie to anyone who likes gangster movies in general and would like to watch a hilarious spin on it.

reviews.review_title: The Best Movie I've Ever Seen
reviews.content: Snatch is most definetely my favorite movie of all time, and I've seen quite a few in my time. Every detail of the film is worked out perfectly and the casting is excellent. Its similarity to Pulp Fiction is visible, but not too eminent, and it is a lot less bloody than Pulp Fiction. The writers of this movie tried to be very original and in my opinion they succeeded greatly, creating some of the most hilarious characters and plot twists. Although this movie is a little excessive in violence, it doesn't have so much that you just want to turn it off. And the swearing in the movie adds to the comedy perfectly. When it came out it wasn't advertised that widely which I think is a good thing because movies with too many previews are no fun to watch because you go in knowing the plot. This movie was a total shocker for me because of the British humor, which I love, and the wonderful acting. Benicia del Toro did an excellent job and Jason Statham was very good as Turkish. This Movie definetely deserves an Oscar or two!

I actually had no desire to see this movie...but my brother practically forced me to watch it and after i did....i wanted to watch it again... The characters were so funny and yet believable at the same time.  I loved Brad Pitt in this movie b/c he wasnt used as another pretty boy...the character of Turkish (also narrater) was my absolute favorite.  If you had reservations about seeing this movie discard them and get it.  Its funny, thrilling and keeps you guessing as to what is going on.

I saw Guy Ritchie's first film, Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels, and loved it.  After reading the reviews of it on this site I couldn't believe it when someone said it was the worst movie ever made.  Snatch is is his second film, and I liked it better than Lock, Stock.  The plot is reasonably complicated, but the acting is brilliant, most notably Brad Pitt, who plays an Irish gypsy. I now own this film on DVD and no matter how many times I watch it it never gets boring. A great film.  I give it 10 out of 10.

... but I'm going to try to describe it anyway...The characters: Every character in this film is a fabulous story alone. Sure, most of them are only one- or two-dimensional, but those dimensions we do see are hilarious, twisted, and unique. Nearly all of them are selfish, violent, mentally ill, loveable criminals.The plot: A bizarre tale of back-stabbing, lying, cheating, and all things illegal. The story twists and tangles over itself like a nasty ball of twine.The filmmaking: As surprising and entertaining as the story and people. The camera is very much a character in this movie, and made me laugh and shake my head in wonder.See this film at least ten times. I promise you'll get something new out of it with each viewing.

What can i say? From the story to the cast everything is perfect in this movie! The fight scenes are awesome, the way brad Pitt talks is a little touch that makes the whole difference, the jokes made by the characters, and even the characters themselves are funny as hell.It's a movie with no fear of being different and original, with simple and little touches that make seeing it time and time again not a bad thing since every time you see it you pick up another great detail you missed the last time you saw it and that is what makes it so good and enjoyable.10 out of 10 no doubt in my opinion

One of the best fight scene in a movie, great performance by Brat Pitt,He almost single handedly steals the show but everybody should see Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrel. Original, not to confound with Quentin Tarantino, it's not the same thing, it's not a pale imitation.

This is one of the best movies I have ever seen! All the characters are so brilliant. After my opinion this is Brad Pit's best movie till now. I love the dialects in this movie, there is a gipsy dialect which Brad masters very well,irish,russian,regular english and Brick Top's way to speak english. Brick Top is the coolest character in the movie, he is a mafia boss who's teeth are in very bad shape and he has some very funny comments, like: "feed em to the pigs" and "im sweet enough". This movie is a master piece.

reviews.review_title: Guy Ritchie is an amazing writer/director
reviews.content: Guy Ritchie is so talented.  HIs movies has a mixture of wit and mayhem! His stlye of writing reminds me a lot of Quentin Tarantino.  It's funny how both of their styles are so alike.  I really love to watch more of Guy Ritchie's films and it's too bad he only directed like 3 movies. He should make a gritty british gangster flick like The Getaway game on ps2. If he won't maybe I'll take the inituitive to write the script myself and have him direct it.

While my friend was suggesting me this movie for quite a long time, I finally managed to bump into it and have become a Guy ritchie fan.Well hats off to the way the movie has been crafted. Be it some out-of-the-world characters portrayed, top class performance by some biggies(read Brad Pitt), dark humour, camera work, background music; everything makes you wanna watch this piece again and again. I quite liked the way various characters were introduced. Also the script is very well written in a way that it needed a tremendous effort to interrelate so many happenings and make something meaningful out of it at the end. But everything seemed to fall into place so smoothly that you don't even feel any glitch whatsoever.Guy ritchie has not only recreated the magic of Lock stock and two smoking barrels, rather he took it one level higher. If you appreciate dark humour then it's a must watch for you. A warning though, don't watch it without subtitles. There are so many accents that you'll definitely loose the grip on the movie without subs.All in all it's a 9/10 for me and I would recommend it to everyone.My fav dialogue from the movie...Brick Top: In the quiet words of the Virgin Mary... come again?

reviews.review_title: Everything I look for in a movie
reviews.content: Snatch is without a doubt one of my favorite movies of all time, actually I cannot come up with another title that tops this one. It's got everything i look for in a movie: humor, action, great atmosphere, super kewl characters (Turkish, Mickey, Boris the Bullet dodger, Bullet tooth Tony, Tyrone!!!), superb soundtrack, a good storyline, very original and inventive filming-techniques, lot's of great one liners. And it's a movie you can watch over and over again. Something I can't say about another very kewl Guy Richie flick; Lock Stock and two smoking barrels.favorite quote: "I thought you said he was a getaway driver, what can he get away from?"I highly recommend this movie and I give it a 9.2/10 score. (#1 on my personal list, but you never know what the future brings us)

No movie has been able to make me laugh as hard as the time I saw Snatch for the tenth time.This is just the perfect comedy.Brad Pitt, the part when he was upset about his ma's death is a masterpiece.Every time I see Vinnie Jones in this flick , I wonder why he is not one of top comedy stars of the decade.The way he proves to 3 black guy why they should f*** off , is simply hilarious as hell.Vinny , Sol and Tyrone just show you How 3 normal guys can be the funniest thing on the planet.That stupid smile of Vinny before introducing the shotgun to Sol gives a nonstop 2 minuets of laughter each time.Brick Top is a bad ass dude that you love " Do you know what nemesis means?" The couple of Tommy and Turkish are the stupidest thing you can find.Turkish seems to be a calm and serious guy but his every single word has lots of comedy behind it.Guy Ritchie just proves that he is one helluva Director and Writer.Some of movie's line are historic , like : " It's Mickey Mouse " or " You can never underestimate the predictability of the stupidity " or Avi's moaning about nobody speaking English in England.The Hare coursing/chasing Tyrone scene and Tony driving the car while having someone's head stuck in it just are unique samples of creative and funny.So I recommend all of you to see the movie ASAP , Before " Zee Germans " get there!

This movie was the coolest movie I've seen in a while. In fact, its one of my favorite movies now. It is hilarious and the ending is awesome. It's worth seeing the movie just to see Brad Pit pull off the gypsie trailor trash accent.

reviews.review_title: The second mark Guy Ritchie has left in film.
reviews.content: Guy Ritchie yet again delivers a fast-pace, dynamic combination of story, visuals and soundtrack, making sure that there isn't a dull moment for the audience to drift off on.the story is centred around a diamond, naturally all the characters want in on its wealth so the plot thickens, a race between characters to the valuable prize.of course the obvious question is, how does it compare to the famous lock, stock and two smoking barrels? Guy Ritchie clearly left a signature on his first film, fortunately this is carried on to snatch and could be developed even further to create more exciting sequences and more compelling scenes than ever before. Guy Ritchie shines so obviously through the film and doesn't let you forget it was him who directed this cinema masterpiece.

For me, as non-native English speaker, this movie, unlike the other 99.99 % , takes a benefit from the excellent job of interpreter. Yeah, ladies and gentlemen, could you ever imagine the variety and beauty of Russian language ability to create combinations around F-word. Rade Serbedzija (Boris the Blade) definitely has some imagination of that, however, was directed to perform just the introductory remarks. I am eager to see my little son growing old enough so I can show him how adult men resolve problems in a real life. In fact, this is a really great movie.

Marvelous movie. One of Brad Pitt's most impressionable performances, competing with his jaw-dropping role on 12 Monkeys. His character makes the movie, his mannerisms, his accent, his way of handling situations, his insane personality; every bit of his amazingly executed role adds up to the magnificence of the whole. Another actor worth mentioning is Benicio del Toro. Apart from the fact that he is a puertorican just like myself (and we puertoricans take that seriously) , he plays an excellent role. This is evident because even though he is cut off half-way through the movie, the impact of the persona of the character he plays stays with us 'til the end. The acting performances of these brilliant actors make the movie. The plot is good, and very well set forth, but the characters displayed are simply wonderful. I mean, who doesn't like seeing Jason Statham play a bad-ass delinquent that drinks milk? From a carton! I know I sure do!

I have seen this movie more than five times! It is an amazing one to watch, it has all the ingredients for a successful movie, the plot is interesting, lots of amazing and unique characters, the accents used in the movie are impressive, and finally what brings it all to good closure is the unpredicted sequence of events. I do not know of many movies that are similar or even come close to the greatness of this movie. You can get many quotes out of this movie and it never gets old or dull. It should be rated as one of the top 10 or 20 movies ever made.I have it and I recommend others to own it!

reviews.review_title: If you've not seen this, Snatch it from the store right now.
reviews.content: If you've seen Lock, Stock and two Smoking Barrels or not, it doesn't matter (Although i rate that film highly).This isn't this huge blockbuster movie, but it doesn't need to be. The budget is clearly low, but that gives it so much more character.Brad Pitt is brilliant in his role. As well as the "sneaky F****** Russian".The film almost has a Pulp Fiction to it. Crime film with lots of story lines which all link in throughout and then come together at the end. A very quotable film as well as Lock, Stock. Vinnie Jones makes a huge improvement in her performance from Lock, Stock.Some good songs throughout which instantly make you want to jump straight over to YouTube and listen to them.Try and pick this film up with the box set along with Lock Stock, and enjoy some twisted, rude and hilarious cockney gangsters getting into all sorts of shenanigans with there mates!

Hi ...Just questioning Boris's name in the film. I thought it was "Boris The Bullet-Dodger", but on here they are referring to his name as "Boris The Blade". I guess it doesn't matter much, and it has been a while since i've seen this kick-azz film, but am I right or am I right? =)Putting that aside for a sec. (Please comment on his name!) I think this is one of the best movies i've seen. Big call I know, but I enjoyed it that much! Pitt's characher was amazing (Pikey) in that I really was struggling to understand him! & that punch of his ... OMG! Pretty tough =) I do like the whole "London Gangster" genre, although movies like The Transporter really drag the chain.

Snatch is a fixed up cocktail of just the right ingredients. From the unlucky underground boxing manager (Jason Statham) to the inarticulate fighting gypsy (Brad Pitt) to completely incompetent jewel thief's, these guys make up a cast of characters that are utterly hilarious when put together. The witty dialogue makes the movie what it is. I feel wittier just by watching it. As an American, its just amusing to hear these quick-tongued Brits go at it. Nearly every scene involves a quip or sly remark. Cop: "What's in the car?" Turkish: "Two seats and a steering wheel." But beyond the cunning wit of the dialog, you have a story of a group of lowlifes, thugs, gangsters, hit men, and gypsies all trying to get the same thing, whether they know it or not. Although, its more like two completely separate stories are being played out simultaneously, but end up converging into one in the end. I won't get into how or why, you'll just have to watch it. My only quarrel with the film is, if you've seen Lock Stock and Two Smoking Barrels, you'll notice a lot of similarities between the two movies. In fact they're almost exactly the same in terms of general plot techniques. Even used some of the same actors filling similar roles. While this isn't enough to discredit this film, I actually think Snatch is far superior, it makes me wonder what Guy Ritchie was thinking.

reviews.review_title: Maybe one of the best(if not the best)comedies ever made
reviews.content: "This movie rocks!" You know that line don't you? It really does rock. I've seen this movie more times than I can count!:) I can watch it every day, and every time it'll make me laugh. Everything about the movie is great. The script, the cast, the soundtrack. Even though the movie is a bit MTV-video-clip-like it still is great. You don't even notice these things until after the movie has finished. The leading actors are great. Jason Statham is one of the best actors these days. Alan Ford also gives an incredible display as "Bricktop". He is just amazing. Benicio Del Toro is also great. He isn't in a lot of scenes, but whenever he is on screen you immediately get to like it. The story is perfect for this type of movie. Diamonds, money, England, funny accent, funny characters. The "Pikeys" are EXTREME. You just love the accent. When they tell Turkish and Tommy they want a caravan for Mickey's mom and the two of them can't understand what are they saying, or when they are betting on the field about the last match and the rabbit. It's just amazing. And the one-liners are great. Just great. My favorites are Alan Ford's "Do you know what nemesis means? A righteous infliction of retribution, manifested by an appropriate agent. Personified in this case by a horrible c-nt. Me!" and Jason Statham's "Protecion from what? Zee Germans!" I give this movie 12 out of 10. Watch it. WATCH IT! NOW! You'll not regret it. This is one of the finest movies ever.

reviews.review_title: It will snatch a hold of your attention
reviews.content: Everything you like in a dark gritty dramedie! Action scenes shot amazingly to compliment the fun and humor along the way

Had never heard of this movie and feeling lucky we picked the movie, Snatch. I loved it although at some points the accents made it difficult to understand the dialogue. Brad Pitt though, played his mushed mouth, multi accented dialogue to perfection. The action was non-stop and this is an entertaining movie. .

"Snatch" is a highly entertaining and stylized crime-comedy film directed by Guy Ritchie, known for his unique filmmaking style and quick-witted dialogue. The movie features an ensemble cast of colorful characters, each with their own distinctive personalities and quirks.At its core, "Snatch" is a caper movie that revolves around a missing diamond and the various characters who are trying to get their hands on it. The movie is filled with twists and turns, as the characters scheme and double-cross each other in their quest for the elusive gem. The film is also notable for its use of non-linear storytelling, as the events of the movie are not presented in chronological order, which keeps the audience on their toes.One of the standout performances in the movie comes from Brad Pitt, who plays the character of "Mickey", an Irish gypsy bare-knuckle boxer with a thick accent and a love for dogs. Pitt's performance is both hilarious and endearing, as he delivers some of the movie's most memorable lines, including the iconic "You like dags?" line.Another standout character in the movie is "Turkish", played by Jason Statham, who is a small-time boxing promoter and one of the central figures in the diamond heist. Statham delivers a charismatic and dynamic performance, which helped to launch his career as an action star.The film's other characters, including the ruthless gangster "Brick Top" (played by Alan Ford) and the bumbling burglars "Sol" and "Vinnie" (played by Lennie James and Robbie Gee), are all well-developed and entertaining in their own right.The movie's fast-paced editing and frenetic camera work help to keep the action moving and the audience engaged. The film also features an excellent soundtrack that includes a mix of classic rock and roll, reggae, and hip-hop, which helps to set the tone and enhance the film's already distinctive style.Overall, "Snatch" is a highly entertaining and well-crafted movie that delivers on both style and substance. The film's clever storytelling, memorable characters, and clever dialogue make it a must-see for fans of the crime genre and anyone who appreciates a well-made movie with a unique sense of style.

reviews.review_title: Looking to be entertained-- and nothing else?
reviews.content: Neither Guy Ritchie or anybody has outdone themselves with this film. It's mediocre enough and exaggeratedly mainstream, but then again there's no shame in earning the day's due pocket cash is there? Although the film quite obviously disguises some clumsy acting with a varying of delightful accents that doubtlessly pull in the non-British/-Irish audience, the overall production does marvelously for what it's meant to be: pure entertainment. It's very funny, very light, with a kick-ass soundtrack and accomplishes the ever-loved concept of turning hateful realities of violence and butchery into buffoonery.It's a fantastic popcorn-beer-and-joint movie. Watch it!

reviews.review_title: No life-changing message, but artistic and *thoroughly* entertaining.
reviews.content: I can think of no other film that surpasses Snatch for pure entertainment value.  What's more, certain sequences are brilliantly artistic and the plot exposition occasionally approaches genius.  This is one that every film aficionado must see.

First off let me just start by saying that I've read most of the user comments and for those of you who have bashed this movie, you need to take it for what it is and supposed to be. I understand one's right to his or her opinion but really, for those of you insistent on bashing the work of others, why aren't you making films? This movie was meant to be fun that's all, it's not a view on the world or Guy Ritchie's solution to the world's problems. If you wanted that maybe you should've stayed home and continued to watch the 'Real World' or 'Survivor'. Something made you see it and I can definately say this was a well thought out and clever movie. It wasn't the best movie ever (as I guess many of you thought it would be) but I'm almost positive it wasn't meant to be either. Go see it and judge it for what it is...fun!

Off-beat directing, filled with unexpected humor and convoluted character relationships. Brad Pitt is amusing and effective, Vinnie Jones is marvelous, and Jason Statham directs the viewer through the movie with the necessary glue. I could have sworn that the director had done either Pulp Fiction or Fight Club. Definitely worth a second viewing, to re-examine relationships.

A great follow-up to "Lock, Stock and 2 Smoking Barrels", Guy Ritchie uses a talented cast to bring together another frenetic tale of crossed paths and out-and-out stupidity. Benicio Del Toro uses his violent tendencies from "Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas", Brad Pitt is losing teeth again as a cunning Gypsy, Dennis Farina seems fresh out of "Get Shorty" and Vinnie Jones is reprising his head-slamming Big Chris role, now even more of a hard-a**e with some unique dental work as Bullet-tooth Tony.Full of laughs, full of gut-wrenching scenes, don't forget to take your Cockney interpreter with you, you'll be speaking it for weeks.

Being a massive fan of 'Lock Stock ...' I was extremely excited by the prospect of the same team revisiting their roots and producing another first class movie. I was, however, to be masssively disappointed.Too many 'nicknamed' characters, who I became increasingly sick of, especially the West Indians who were just plain annoying. Each character was given a fleeting glimpse in short scenes to come up with a cockney quip, then onto the next scene. The characteristic 'Tarantinoesque' snap scene , shown a number of different time in multiple views. It lacked the charm and natural wit of its predecessor. In the end I had absolutely no interest in who ended up with the diamond, just as long as it wasn't the West Indians!!Highlights were Brad Pitt, who was marvellous and of course Vinnie, who had the best line in the movie when retorting to his bosses request to open up the dog. 'Open it up? Its not a tin of f***in beans!'.I still think Mr Ritchie has loads of talent that will produce wonderful movies but maybe the idea of bettering Lock Stock, should've been forgotten.

Guy Ritchie has recreated what he did with LockStock and it is true that Snatch is cinematographically a more accomplished movie than his full-length debut.If you were a fan of the old movie (that is having seen it 10+ times) you will be disappointed, otherwise it truly is a great and entertaining movie.This should probably work well in America where LockStock was not as big as it was in England.7/10

Hard to believe that this movie received such high ratings. It is very "fake cool," all the actors, especially the awful Dennis Farina, trying to be oh-so-tough in their overacted portrayals. The director, Guy Ritchie, is no better, trying to liven up a dumb story with little bells and whistles that are just embarrassing.
What a great movie ,fast, furious, outragous comedy and cockney slang to top it off.my fav characters ?  Vincent and Sol bricktop, and tommy.a Must buy on DVD and a movie to watch over and over

reviews.review_title: If you only watch one sequel this DECADE...
reviews.content: ...then make sure it's Snatch, the fast-paced, foul-mouthed, drunken court jester of a movie. With this masterpiece, Guy Ritchie proves that 1: he's no one-hit-wonder director and 2: America is going to have to seriously rethink its views about Britain's movie industry. If you though Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels was funny, Snatch will probably give you a hernia from laughing so hard. A big standing ovation to Jason Statham(played Bacon in Lock Stock) and Vinnie Jones (Big Chris from Lock Stock)for perfecting the dry sarcasm that made this movie's predecessor so popular, and congratulations to Brad Pitt for getting that accent down.

Guy Ritchie has outdone himself and bettered the classic, 'Lock Stock'. 'Snatch' may seem  very similar to Ritchie's first film and its spin-off TV show at first, but fears of it simply being 'Lock Stock 2' are quickly laid to rest.The acting from Vinnie Jones, Brad Pitt and Jason Statham amongst a whole host of others is top notch. While the script and plotting is fast and funny, leaving you wanting more at the films conclusion.It's definitely the best film of this year and thus this century too. Put simply, a must-see movie whatever side of the Atlantic you live on.Now repeat after me "I hate f***ing pikeys!"

snatch is phenomenal! althought the soundtrack is a loose working version and due to change, the movie is incredible. i was expecting something special and as such thought i'd be let down; but quite the opposite - the movie outshines `lock, stock'. It's faster, funnier and cooler. The brad pitt (mickey) fight scene nearing the conclusion of the movie is pure post-trainspotting cool. absolutley brilliant! 11/10!!!

reviews.review_title: Gun blasting, fist flying action and then theres our Vinny and Brad....
reviews.content: This film is a blast and a must see for all of you.  I reckon that if this had been released b4 'Lock, Stock.....' then it would have got more acclaim than it will now just for the fact that it is more of the same.  Parts of Lock Stock creep through ( vinnys opening scene, similar characters, classic one liners) while being good, does make you think that Guy Ritchie has played the safe option of using tried and trusted material as opposed to something more original. The characters are good - Boris 'the blade' is a great character just for the fact he just wont die!!, Brad Pitt suits playing the irish boxer down to the ground.  Some good use of alternate camera angles and you have an entertaining film - possibly the best ive seen this year (except SHAFT). 8 out of 10

reviews.review_title: i have never seen brad pitt in such a good movie
reviews.content: ive never seen brad pitt in such a great role. its guy ritchey at his best i loved the movie its been my favourite since ive seen it i loved benicio del toro too he was tremendous ive never seen such a good movie as snatch i recommend people to see this movie.

reviews.review_title: Simply the best comedy this year !!!
reviews.content: I think the kind of humor in this typicly English movie is far supirieur on the American humor. It is hard to describe, but if I have to, I should say it's Tarantino movie in UK style. Everybody who loves this movie should also see Lock, Stock and two Smoking Barrels. It is also a movie directed by Guy Richie.

Funny, well directed but unfortunately NOT original. Same plot with "Lock Stock and Two smoking Barrels". Anyone that has seen that, will understand how similar the two movies are. The truth is that I expected something more from the director as I was thrilled when I saw his previous movie "Lock Stock...".

I was lucky enough to see this movie at a special preview and being a huge Lock Stock fan I was concerned that this was going to be a massive let down. How wrong I was! Having expected the worse, but hoped for the best, the movie delivered far, far more than my highest expectation. It was visually unique, funny, serious and bizarre all at once! Vinnie Jones again steals the movie with a great performance, showing the way to a fabulous cast. When this movie opens, its going to be huge, see you at the Oscars Guy!!!!

Having liked Lock, Stock... a lot, I came to this with plenty of expectations and received very few surprises. It does all of the same things as Guy Ritchies first hit - some of them better and some worse. The plotting was if anything even tighter, the script funny in parts but far too much of a retread to produce much in the way of real laughs. Brad Pitt was excellent and featured in practically every memorable scene in the film, which came as something of a surprise to me. The greatest disappointment for me, though, was the selection of music for the soundtrack which was decidedly lacklustre - even moreso in comparison with the truly excellent soundtrack which accompanied Lock, Stock...

reviews.review_title: Lock Stock one-upped, in any sense
reviews.content: On the strength of single viewing my comments my be a bit chaotic, but so was the film. In the best possible sense, that is. Guy Ritchie goes one better with this one. "Snatch" retreads exactly the same routes as in his previous effort: criminal underachievers vs hilariously sinister kingpins with farcical poetic justice madly flying around.He utilizes cautiously the benefits of a larger budget and a flashier cast to commendable effect. The creative casting excats  the initial smile, from then on the excitement goes from strength to strength. The flow of ridiculously implausible twists of LOCK STOCK, is balanced here by genuinely sinister ones.Although some criticism may be mounted against Ritchie for offering nothing new stylisticly and storywise, it will only hold until the first minutes after you've taken your seat in the theatre.8/10

Guy Ritchie and the boys show that Lock, Stock & Two Smoking Barrels was just a launch pad.Snatch juggles more characters, more convuluted plotlines and more gags than Lock, Stock, and is a far more satisfying treat.The cinematography is spot on the money, slick without looking like a commercial. The soundtrack is pumping, and even manages to fit in a (personal joke?) Madonna track.Every principle, of which there certainly are a few, turn in excellent performances, bringing their cartoon character gangsters to life. Bullet Tooth, Four Fingers, Brick Top? Do people really have names like these?Brad Pitt manages to invent a whole new language (pikey), Mike Reid shows he does have a life outside of Eastenders and smutty stand up, and there's even a chance for Ewen Bremner to roughly reprise his role as Spud in Trainspotting.Catch it before ze germans arrive.

Excellent, well funny, a superb follow on from Lock, Stock & 2 Smoking Barrels. Bit more blood and gore than Lock, Stock, but some really hilarious one liners. Mike Reid was a bit of a let down - he is much funnier as Frank in Eastenders! But Vinnie Jones was his usual cool, quick witted self and "Mullet" & "Turkish" were a great comedy pair. The trio gang of black guys were immensely funny too. This film is a must see!

reviews.review_title: Guy Ritchie has done it again!
reviews.content: After such a classic piece of cinema, like "Lock, Stock...", you'd think the pressure of making his second full length film, might weigh down the plot or direction. I'm happy to say that Guy Ritchie has done it again, making a movie that will no doubt become a classic action film. Set in London, "Snatch" is the story of Turkish and Tommy, two unlicenced boxing promoters who get in trouble with a gangster named Brick Top. Turkish's boxer, Gorgeous George is supposed to go down in the 4th round but when Tommy and George got into some hot water with a group of gypsies led by Mickey O'Neil (Brad Pitt, in one of his best performances). George gets into a fight with Mickey and Mickey knocks George's lights into the next world. Turkish decides to substitute Mickey for George in the big fight but when Mickey doesn't go down in the 4th, Turkish and Tommy sink deeper into trouble.In another plot line, jewish diamond thief, Franky Four Fingers (Benico Del Toro) steals a diamond "the size of a fist" and is then robbed buy 3 stupid jewelry wholesalers and their crazy gypsie dog. But they run into one small problem, the case with the stone in it is chained to Franky's arm, so they take Franky with them to meet the buyer, russian ex-KGB assassin, Boris the Blade. Back in the USA, Cousin Avi (Denis Farina, playing another foul mouthed mobster) finds out that Franky has been robbed and he won't get his giant diamond. Avi flies to London and must find his 86 karat stone with the help of Bullet Tooth Tony (Vinnie Jones) a man who took six bullets to the head and is still tickin'. He even had some of the bullets molded into teeth to replace the one's he lost. Sound complicated? Don't worry, it's not. With his brilliant directing style, Richie has made a movie that will make you laugh, cry and maybe even puke if you have a Really weak stomach. Plus some of the best boxing sequences filmed since "Raging Bull" Any way you slice it, "Snatch" is a winner! 10/10
This is what I call a phenomenal non-stupid entertaining movie with great musical beats.I simply loved it.Ritchie is finding his way...

Phew! What a movie. Mr Ritchie really knows his stuff. Action, violence and humour - the perfect combination for a (near) perfect movie! And how about those names - surely One Punch Mickey, Doug the Head, Brick Top etc are the best aliases since Reservoir Dogs. Can't wait for the next one...

reviews.review_title: snatch is a breath of fresh air
reviews.content: Review Snatch is the new movie from Guy Ritchie (lock, stock, and 2 smoking barrels,,madonna's hubby)and stars Brad Pitt, Dennis Farrina, and Benicio Del Toro to name a few. The story revolves around a jewel heist and a bunch of gangster types trying to locate a 86 karat diamond that was stolen. If you enjoyed Lock, Stock at all then Snatch will totally blow you away with the great performances, illegal hi-jinx and magnificent camera work that shows one reason Guy Ritchie is one of the best and most cutting edge directors out there. The story will keep you on the edge of your seat and the ending is as satisfying as it can be, you will be talking about the movie before you leave the theatre. Go see this ASAP!

It is Quentin Tarantino a la "Trainspotting" style. Taste of British humor makes the big difference from other modern "tough guys" films of American origin. Acting excellent, in particular Dennis Farina is in another amazing role after "Get Shorty".

hey guys. this film is one of the best of 2000. it's a shame we americans had to wait so long to see it! brad pitt gives an excellent turn, if you can understand a word the man says. benicio del toro is also right on par (when isn't he!?) as a diamond thief. the rest of the cast is great as well, and i encourage EVERYONE to go see it Jan. 19th!!

reviews.review_title: been there, done that, but it still kicks butt!
reviews.content: okay, most, if not all, reviews of "snatch" inevitably state that it is exactly like "lock, stock, and two smoking barrels," down to plot twists, dialogue, characters, and actors.  this is true.  "snatch" contains all of the elements that made "lock, stock" a major hit.  but it does it even better.  so what if guy ritchie's script and direction is nearly identical? he's given "snatch" a better script and better actors.  the script is just marvelous, the camera gimmicks are more entertaining and enhancing than pretentious.  and brad pitt gives his best performance as a gypsy irish who is even more indecipherable than benicio del toro's mumbles in "usual suspects."  mike reid as brick top is utterly frightening, boris the blade is hilarious, and the scenes with tyrone, vincent, sol and the dog are unbelievably funny.  go see this movie. it's fast, furious, and an absolutely wonderful time.

When I entered the theatre to see Snatch, I had some idea of what to get. But I got a little surprised as well. I had read some reviews of the movie, and they were telling me that this was a movie, pretty similar to "Lock, Stock & Two Smoking Barrels". And the movie was, by all means.But sometimes there is more to a movie than just the plot. Consider the details that you experience in this movie, and you'll know what I mean. First of all, the "Gipsy-Pitt" is a geniously played part. You'll understand 50% of what Brad Pitt is saying, but that's how it is supposed to be. Another detail that is excellent, is the cutting from L.A. to London. Three small cuts, that is mixed together, and makes it understanding that a person leaves from one city to another. Great details here.As when it comes to the actors, I would say that the two best ones here, is Benicio Del Toro, as a gambling diamond robber (by the way a good Rabbi), and Brad Pitt as a ravelling gipsy. Two genious actors that is escalating the complete picture.Overall, go see the movie, and judge by yourself.

Guy Ritchie. I'd never heard of him before seeing this movie and looking it up. He is brilliant. Snatch was entertaining and then some... it was well written, fast paced, funny, full of action, etc. And I love the more "artistic" directing style. The characters (which there were alot of! I loved the intro!) were excellent and the dialogue was great. I don't normally write reviews for movies on here, because I'm never quite sure what to say. And I don't like to give anything away (heck, most movie previews do that for you). But I basically wanted to mention how much I enjoyed this film. It's one of the best I've seen in awhile.

Why? Just why? I would have serious concern for the state of mental health of anyone that enjoyed this film. Even writing a few statements in review is a waste of time.
Totally insipid trash - with some interesting editing.

If you like movies with multiple story lines and some dark comedy, then you will truly love this movie.I watched this movie only 3 times in the first week.You really need to watch it at least twice to pick it all up.The accent used by Brad Pitt was a bit difficult to understand, but after a second or third viewing the context was intelligible.There are great characters, with some really awesome lines. If you like to quote lines from movies, then this will really give you a lot of material. Probably better than Crash and 11:14, though those are also good movies with multiple story lines.A great flick.

Snatch...What can I say other than this is one of the best films that I have seen in the theatre in a long time(along with traffic). I am a 16 year old male currently in 11th grade. I went to see this flick with numerous people from my school, who all enjoyed this movie a lot. Even the girls liked it. This movie was stereotyped to be another pulp fiction, and it was not completely different, but I would hate to choose b/w them. I loved everything about this movie, the comedy, the action, the fighting, the drama. And especially the accents, they were incredible. The movie would not have been the same w/o them. I usually do not like Brad Pitt for the types of girlie movies that he does, but when he goes into a role like this one, he is incredible. Just like he was in Seven. I dont want to bore you with an essay about a movie, cause I am 16 and dont feel like writing one, so i'll say this: Snatch is a great movie, but not the best movie to see on a date. Because you may spend more time watching the movie then you will with youre date. Unless she likes action/comedies. In which case youve got a hell of a girlfriend. GO SEE SNATCH!!!! Thanks for youre time. -Bryan

Best Guy Ritchie's movie ! Fantastic cast !
I love this movie !
...but with a better cast, better direction, more wit, more action, and more laughs.  Do not listen to the quibbling critics.  See this. It's a hoot.PKL

reviews.review_title: Good film, but a bit heavy on the accents
reviews.content: I know that Brad Pitt's thick accent in the film is a running joke throughout the movie, but his isn't the only one. Most of the actors are hard to understand. However, definitely worth seeing, and one for the DVD collection.

This is an cracking,fantastic,outstanding movie,with not only gun-fights,drugs-deals and a interesting and fascinating story,it also has good humor and classy actors,with magnificent acting. Brad Pitt,as always he's totally into his role,and plays the person like it was really him,the accent.Vinnie Jones,really cool,brilliant acting. This is a MUST,you must see it,really the acting amazed me and i this is one of the best movies I've ever seen!!!!!!!

A breath of fresh air from the many movies out there that seem like mirror images, Snatch is as eye-opening and intriguing to watch as "Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels".  With amazing cast performances, (and also arguably one of Pitt's best), it never ceases with excitement, with a few twists and turns in some unexpected directions. With Ritchie's direction, it's obvious who has landed this gem.

reviews.review_title: Funny, interesting and almost unique - except for Lock Stock & 2 Smoking Barrels
reviews.content: Okay, so here's the deal with this movie: its an absolutely amazing movie. That is, if, and only if, you haven't seen Guy Ritchie's other great movie: Lock, Stock & Two Smoking Barrels. Despite being cleverly crafted to all come together in one magnificant moment - much like LS&2SB - and being full of both, humour and serious moments, Snatch was somewhat of a let down to me. If you haven't already seen Lock, Stock I recommend picking one of the two. The format, the characters, the same reference to a certain group of people (ze germans in this case) was all too Lock Stock; there was a point where I wasn't sure which movie I was watching anymore. But if you manage to get over that little upset, you'll find Lock Stock to be an entertaining movie which does draw close parallels to the real world of illegal boxing. All in all, my hats off to Guy Ritchie for the most part, although change is never a bad thing. Also, my compliments to the person who did the casting. Each actor really truly fit their part - including Brad Pitt, who personally I thought would no way be able to play a pikey. I was wrong.

reviews.review_title: A roller coaster of thrilling fun!
reviews.content: First, I must say GO see Snatch!!  It is hilariously funny, especially Turkish and his sidekick.  It has wonderful visual arts, especially with Brad Pitt.  His character is so likable and emotional.  It is a light thriller with a 83 carat diamond.  It goes from Frankie Four Fingers, to Sol, and ends up in its "rightful owner".  You must see Snatch, it is a riot, with twists turns, and laughs.  P.s.  the dog is the best!!

reviews.review_title: A fast-paced action film, one of the greatest of it's genre!
reviews.content: This movie was tremendous.  It immediately attacks the senses with a pulsing soundtrack and amazing camerawork from beginning to end.  Brad Pitt gives a performance that is both hilarious and rousing as pikey boxer Mickey. Benicio Del Toro's character, Franky Four Fingers, doesn't get the camera time he deserves, but definately steals every scene he's in.  Go see this movie now!

reviews.review_title: 'Snatch' is delicious...in more ways than one
reviews.content: "Snatch" gave me my fix. I've read or heard some people say that they didn't like this because it had too many similarities to Ritchie's previous film "LS2SB," and they are right. Double-crosses, almost need subtitles accents, Vinnie Jones playing a muscle for hire, and instead of two funny bumbling crooks like "LS2SB," we have three absolutely hysterical bumbling crooks here, and many more that I haven't mentioned. Why don't I mention them? Because it doesn't matter because "Snatch" is one hell of a flick. I can't say which is better. "Lock, Stock..." had a very good premise and also had heart in the right places (notably the father-son relationships between some of the characters), and also had a lot of laughs. "Snatch" cuts right to the teeth with biting dark comedy and great performances by the players involved. The great Benicio Del Toro does what he can with relatively small screen time. Jason Statham has grown since "Lock, Stock...", probably because Ritchie gave him a bigger role as Turkish. And you gotta love the Yanks of the film: Dennis Farina and Brad Pitt. With his demanding attitude and sharp lines, Farina shells out one of his best performances of his career. Pitt is like a limey Tyler Durden without the darkness and more humorous spunk. I think Ritchie's plan to have Pitt speak that dialect was because not one American could understand what the characters said in "Lock, Stock..." (even I had to use closed captioning a couple times). So, he gets an American actor who speaks something no one understood to hilarious effect. But, the top performance here goes to Alan Ford. The narrator of "Lock, Stock..." creates a frightening yet funny character in Brick Top. He says most of the films best lines and has probably the best facial expressions in the film (most likely helped by those thick-rimmed glasses).All in all, this was a great film. And while I will always follow Ritchie in his career, I think he should put the crime genre away for at least a few films. He is capable of so much more, and it's evident in his stylish direction and his ear for sharp dialogue. What I say to him is good luck, and don't put Madonna in ANY of your films. Maybe sing on the soundtrack, but not act. She's not as British as she pretends to be.

Chaotic, witty, eccentric, and hip, Guy Ritchie's latest film "Snatch" is a visual bombast involving an eclectic array of intriguing characters. Ritchie takes us on a fast-paced ride through London, introducing us to a four-fingered gambler (Del Toro), a saturnine boxing promoter named Turkish (Statham), his lovable maladroit partner Tommy (Graham), a bullet-dodging Russian (Serbedzija), the wanna-be-jewish diamond dealer Doug the Head (Reid), the authentic jewish diamond dealer Cousin Avi (Farina), a marble-mouthed gypsy boxer (Pitt), and many other diversified characters. Each personality has it's own individualized mark which together form a melange of the bizarre. Set in London, the story follows what happens surrounding a much sought after 84 karat diamond. As the plot begins to unfold, the interlocking stories involving unlicensed boxing, stolen diamonds, and caravans are revealed to make for a witty nearly unimaginable ending. Ritchie's innovative cinematography including quick paced action-to-freeze-frame-cuts and split screens is captivating, stylish, zany, and full of frenetic energy. In addition to Ritchie's remarkable camerawork, his choice of music is not to be left unnoticed. Offbeat cuts like Klint's Diamond, Disco Science by Mirwais, and Massive Attack's Angel coexist perfectly with the skittish visuals. The music, cinematography, witty dialogue, and bewitching characters are only a few distinguishable features of many in this cleverly hilarious and entertaining comedy. Snatch is well worth the money, time, and energy.

I thought this was a great film; from Brad Pitt's gypsy brogue to the quick and witty jokes that one so often witnesses in the criminal world. Although, I was still having trouble understanding just what everyone was saying, i still enjoyed the fast-paced action and clever camera work.

reviews.review_title: Guy Ritchie has made an all time classic
reviews.content:
I remember 1st seeing this after lock stock & 2 smoking barrels (which I can add is an awesome Brit flick), so I was eager to see this definitely. My god, this has got to one of the most funniest & cleverest dark comedies I've ever come across. With excellent performances from an all star cast (vinnie Jones, Jason statham, Alan Ford, Brad Pitt, Mike Reid plus many more) you can't go wrong at all with snatch. It's not just the line up of actors that keep you intrigued.... the way that guy ritchie has made this movie is unique to say the least & absolutely works (e.g. innovative camera work, a various soundtrack that will appeal to everyone, & a wise cracking narrative by statham). Plus the way that the storylines of all the characters interweaving is very original. The main source of the all the events of the film involves the aftermath of a stolen diamond that's worth a lot. So be prepared for a hilarious mixture of characters... 2 naive boxing promoters, a gypsy that plays by his own rules, wannabe diamond merchants, a scene stealing psycho gangster with an obsession of pigs, inexperienced armed robbers. Plus there's many more characters that are gonna make you entertained from start to finish.
I definitely recommend snatch to almost anyone

reviews.review_title: If you didn't like it, open your eyes
reviews.content: I couldn't believe what I was reading as I was checking out the user reviews for this movie...  People actually didn't like this??  What movie were they watching??  It has been along time since I have seen something good in this movies, and this was just what I needed.  I saw Lock Stock and enjoyed this much more because of the better acting and charaters.  Brad Pitt took a little hint from Benico Del Toro's character in The Usual Suspects and turned in a memorable performance (although I don't think you'll see many of his lines for movie quote quizzes).  The people that didn't like this movie weren't really watching it.  They sat there an analyzed every aspect instead of just sitting back, feeding your face with popcorn, and enjoying. Definitely go see this...

Snatch is hilarious! One of the best movies to come out all year. Thanks to snatch and lock stock and two smokin barrels I will now got to see anything Guy Ritchy does! It is also very simalir to Lock stock an two smokin barrles, except instead of a diamond its drugs everybody is after.

A truly outstanding movie, with marvellous characters and a great cast. The directing is enjoyfully intense, creating an atmosphere of real-life yet maintaining its surreality through some almost cartoonlike scenes. Even the dialogue is witty not to mention the superb music, which truly enriches the movie for the better. Most importantly, this is a concise moviegoing package that does not let the viewer down. See it and Enjoy!

reviews.review_title: Quick paced, love the British Humor..
reviews.content: I love the British humor tied in through the twisting plot. A lot of my friends complain it was too confusing, but i feel the confusion is what makes this movie great.  At first i didn't like the fact that Brad Pitt (one of my favorite actors) had such a small role but after watching it i see that the dimunative role that he plays makes him that much more memorable. I definitely would like to see Guy Richardson come out with another movie with the same feel as this one.

Gypsy English > British English.Gypsy English > British English
Gypsy English > British English
Gypsy English > British English
Gypsy English > British English
Gypsy English > British English
Gypsy English > British English.

this film is one of the best i've ever seen - if you haven't seen it already, i suggest you go watch it. i love how the two separate stories mold together, and the jokes, the story line, and basically the whole thing. i also love how the gypsy camp looks like an actual gypsy camp! if you've ever been through one, you'll know what i mean. the boxing scenes are totally awesome, too. i especially love the end fight, and the end shooting got my sitting on the edge of my seat. it also portrays england really well. heh, of course. *thumbs up* go watch it, now :P you wont be sorry. and i'm aware that some of you think this film is a pile, but this is just my opinion!

reviews.review_title: One of the best Movies of all time !!
reviews.content: This is without a doubt one of the best movies I ever seen, and I think that it is a movie experience for everyone ! so do yourself a favor and go see it now !! This movie is a classic, or at least it should be. The thing I like the most about this movie is that you follow a wide cast of characters so mix it all together and you got one hell of a movie.

This is definitely my favorite movie. For me, it surpasses even the Godfather in greatness. Its basically about a stolen diamond, and the twists and turns it takes through several very entertaining characters. I have seen this film probably 30 times, I can quote everything before its said, yet it still makes me laugh. The British humor in it is very funny. I also really like the music. If you havent seen this movie, you should.

I did not expect that this film would be so good. I enjoyed it a lot, and I suggest it for everyone that want to see a good film that's not so common. The story is so rich, and Brad Pitt is proving at each film that he is a great actor.

reviews.review_title: An intelligent comedy with terrific characters and a well thought plot. May need to watch it a few times too truely 'get it'.
reviews.content: I can't get enough of this movie, Snatch has to be the most well-thought out comedy ever to grace the screen. I'm not a big Guy Richie fan, but I must commend him for this one!I can watch this movie 4 or 5 times in a row and still never get bored with it. Be careful tho, some people just aren't sharp enough to keep up. ;)

One thing I really enjoyed about this movie was the selection of actors. Brad Pitt didn't have a major role in it and neither did Benicio Del Torro, who are both regularly main characters in other movies. The other actors did a great job at playing their roles. The story was wonderfully crafted. It's one of those movies where there are really no good guys or bad guys. I mean there is a "bad guy" in this movie, but he's a cool bad guy, the kind you want to be if you were a bad guy. Being Canadian, I found it a bit hard to understand the movie at times, because of all the British accents, but the second and third time I saw it, I got used to it. Vinnie Jones plays an awesome tough guy and the best thing is that he's not the expressionless type of tough guy, he's the type that loves Madonna songs (hint: Guy Ritchie). Another thing I loved about this movie is the music. It ranges from funky flutes to scratchy distorted techno. This movie is a great comedy with a well written story.
I was so immersed time and space meant nothing to me in that 104 min.
Damn good comedy that doesn't need to exaggerate any scene with no stupid joke, fall or blow, this movie just works so well, if there's any word to describe it is brilliant.

This movie is one of the best movies I've seen in a long time. It ranks right up there with Pulp Fiction, Fight Club, Se7en, and others. It's paced really well and has likeable characters. The story itself is amazing and it's put together really good. I recommend this movie to anyone who is a fan of Tarintino, and Robert Rodriguez. It's amazing.

reviews.review_title: Tongue In Cheek Violence. Ethereal People.
reviews.content: Snatch is a movie that practices tongue-in-cheek violence. The director walks the line between "heh!" and "ugh!" right thru the film. There are no good guys in Guy Ritchie's world of shade. Just good bad guys and bad bad guys. Of course, for Del Torro or Pitt fans, its a great watch as both deliver captivating performances with elan. Although the plot is fundamentally slapstick and will at no point tickle your grey cells, Ritchie paints a picture better than he builds a story. Not a movie with a beginning and an ending. Rather, a glimpse into the somewhat nocturnal and mostly violent lives of a set of people who, at the end, seem to fit rather ethereally into the plot.

reviews.review_title: Black humor, violence, action, great acting / directing and great soundtrack
reviews.content: This is definitely one of the best movies ever made, due to the outstanding performance of the actors, the storyline, excellent directing, an enormous amount of humor, some violence and finally a superb soundtrack. All this is well mixed up by Guy Richie, who just knows how to make a great movie.

reviews.review_title: Some of the funniest dialogue ever captured on film!
reviews.content: This is a terrific movie. It has some of the funniest dialogue ever captured on film! The characters are unique and hysterical - with a fantastic story to boot! It has a "Pulp Fiction" type appeal with an even better story "intersection". Be forewarned, this is a dialogue driven movie and only for those able to listen closely through the British accents.

reviews.review_title: Hilarious. Perfect style, amazing characters, good violence.
reviews.content: This movie was absolutely hilarious.  I have watched it many times and am still not sick of it.  The characters, the camerawork, and the story make this movie worth seeing.  It is violent, and vulgar, but it is top notch (and very humorous) violence and vulgarity.  Profanity usually turns me off, but in this movie I laugh every time they tell each other to f--- off. I am soooooo tired of the monotonous, moral telling, happy ending movies! That's why this movie is so great.  There's NO love interests or touching moments, and no character in this movie gives a crap about anybody else, but themselves.  To me, this movie is NOT a heavy hitter as some might say, but if you get your panties in a wad over four letter words, comical violence, or bare knuckle fighting, you need to rent "Meet the Parents" because "Snatch" isn't for you.Brad Pitt is an amazing actor!  His character is definitely my favorite.  I also love the guy who plays 'Turkish', he surprised me with his ability. And the guy who plays 'Bullet Tooth Tony' cracks me up when he breaks into his educated monologue, spewing big words you wouldn't expect out of a scarry looking guy like that.I also like the fact that this movie doesn't take itself too seriously.  It isn't condemning the life of gypsies, mobsters, petty thieves, hit men, or anyone else; it's basically telling a funny story (without an end).  The background music fits perfectly throughout, and is very entertaining.  The one liners keep this movie rolling till the end.  They may not be LOL funny, but if you've got an open mind, they'll make you chuckle.It's a light hearted 'Fight Club', and gives Brad Pitt the absolute ability to prove his talent.  I think an older son and his Dad could sit and talk about this movie for a while after it's over.RENT IT!"Need to have a s***e!"

reviews.review_title: Almost no one I know saw this gem!!
reviews.content: I think this is a very underrated movie. When it came out it didn't get a lot of hype or anything but it is a extremely funny film. Guy Ritchie is a very good writer, although a very bizarre human being :) Very good chemistry between Robbie Gee, Lennie James and Ade. Alan Ford is an awesome bad guy. Brad Pitt is hilarious. Everyone was great, but Vinnie Jones and Rade Serbedzija made me laugh the most.

Snatch, written and directed by Guy Ritchie is an unusual yet highly amusing and entertaining British film. It is a story full of twists and turns about an 86-karat diamond and how an assortment of very different criminals get pulled together and played off against one another as they try to get their hands on it. The film has several subplots but the strands of the story are expertly woven together into an exciting climax.The editing is superb and has a very similar style as Guy Ritchie's previous film Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels. The film uses unusual camera angles and strange shots and unconventional lighting to give the viewer insight into the emotions of the character at that particular time. Snatch has a similar gritty, bleached-out colour as Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels had, but Snatch definitely has more to offer in the way of special effects and slow-motion scenes. The slow-motion in various action scenes adds a great deal to the film by wrenching the audiences out of fast action and making them hold their breath and think until the slow-motion clip ends. This adds greatly to the suspense of the film. Every cinema going person will notice the effect the slow-motion has on them as they see the rabbit hunting and finale scenes. The film's music adds greatly to its entertainment value and along with unconventional camera angles and superb acting the music makes scenes such as the knockout of Gorgeous George highly amusing.Snatch has a Pulp Fiction style in the way the story jumps from the past to the future and then back to the past again to explain an event that had just happened. This jumping around keeps the audience on its toes and is easy enough to understand, but a word of warning though: if you miss a minute or two you may find it very difficult to understand what's going on in the film.The character development of this film is masterful, the larger than life characters are interesting, amusing and very well played by the talented cast. The dialogue is intelligent and funny in a dry British sort of way. The film contains many superb performances from impressive actors such as Vinnie Jones as 'Bullet Tooth Tony', Brad Pitt as the incomprehensible gypsy 'Mickey O'Neil', Jason Statham who both narrates much of the film and plays the character 'Turkish' proves he is an excellent actor, Alan Ford as the detestable 'Brick Top Polford', and Rade Serbedzija who plays the amusing 'Boris the Blade'. Other actors include Benicio Del Toro and Dennis Farina who also put in good efforts.This film is not perfect though. Some people would attribute this films success to its flashiness, and this is true to a point, but without this flashiness the film would definitely be bland and maybe too much like any Hollywood offering. Some people complain that the film 'borrows' many elements of its plot and style from Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels. This is true, but in my opinion this hardly detracts much from the film as a whole.Overall despite some minor flaws this film is well made, entertaining and most definately worth seeing. If you keep an open mind when watching this film and don't take it too seriously you will almost certainly enjoy it. I give it 8 out of 10.

reviews.review_title: I give so much credit to Guy Ritchie
reviews.content: Every once and a while a movie comes along that I buy as soon as I see it. Snatch was one of them. Brad Pitt is amazing, Benecio Del Toro is incredible, and they are supported by an outstanding cast. This definitely stands as one of my favorite movies, the plot is so juicy and the characters are so well defined. If you haven't seen it, see it, if you have, see it again.

reviews.review_title: What do unlicensed boxing promoters, pig-feeding gangsters, diamond thieves, unkillable ex-KGB operatives, gypsies, and shady pawnbrokers have in common?
reviews.content: The answer to this riddle is found in about two hours of the most brilliantly comical moviemaking since.....well, actually, I can't think of anything at the moment that compares.The trailers for this movie never got me interested enough to actually get off my duff and get to the theater to see it on the big screen.  The downside is that I almost missed seeing one of the funniest movies I have ever seen in my life.  The upside is that when my wife rented it on a whim, we could pause it when we were laughing so hard we could hardly breathe.  We ended up buying it on VHS and then again when we got DVD...and we simply don't buy movies.  Ain't generally worth it...but this one is.That said, Snatch isn't for everybody.  For one thing, there's enough coarse language to crisp the ears of any easily offended person who gets within hearing distance.  It's also very fast paced, laced with a patchwork of dialects and accents that aren't always easy to understand (which is kinda the point, actually), and requires the audience to actually pay attention.  It's this last requirement that loses the most fans, I would guess, given the ridiculous popularity of mindless drivel starring "actors" like friggin' Britney Spears, fer cryin'  out loud.Suffice it to say that if you appreciate irony, cynical humor, black comedy, and well written, well acted character drama more than special effects, gimmicks, gratuitous nudity (not that I'm knocking gratuitous nudity), stupid stunts and all the other pap Hollywood is cookie-cutter stamping out these days, then you'll love Snatch. Otherwise, go watch just about anything Brian De Palma ever put out.

reviews.review_title: So good I could see it over and over again
reviews.content: If I would have to give an Oscar to Brad (so far) I would do it for the way he played the gypsy in this movie. He did it so well it's really a master piece. The attitude, the gestures, the way he talks, the way he moves, fights, drinks, even smells is just like but from real life and put on the screen. The story, the characters, the pace, the sounds, the image makes out of this comedy movie a real masterpiece of the genre. Also, the other actors contribution is complementing the movie so well it is impossible not to follow it till the last second of it. The cast is outstanding packed with heavy names and they all give out the best for this story. There's no need to say more. I am giving it top score cause it couldn't have been done better.Peace, Love and Godspeed.

reviews.review_title: Another quirky one from Guy Ritchie 8.5 out of 10
reviews.content: If you liked 'Lock, Stock, and 2 Smoking Barrels' then Snatch is probably up your alley.  Be warned, if you can't tolerate or understand British accents (specifically Cockney, I think) then don't bother!!!  This is full of plot twists, extremely colorful characters and you've got to have a unique sense of humor to enjoy it.  I'm not a big Brad Pitt fan, but he was actually pretty good as the unintelligible gypsy boxer.  I'm a big Benicio del Toro fan and he's got a minor role as the gambling-addicted Frankie Four Fingers. I love movie quotes but, unfortunately, most of the best from this movie aren't suitable.  This is probably more of a guy movie and probably not a good date movie rental.  All told, I give it 8.5.

Wow what a film from the off statham and pitt play there parts to perfection the storyline amazingly thought out!! A must see for all gangster tpe film lovers!!! Oh and not forgetting are very own frank butcher!! I would rate this highly on the same level as Lock stock by far the best film I have seen to date!

Anyone who didn't like this movie just didn't get it. The British humor here is what makes it so perfect. The editing, the directing, the script is all brilliant. Even Brad Pitts accent is pretty impressive. Some people who haven't been to englandmight think it's overdone..but it really isn't. It's hilarious. The whole film is so clever, interweaving two plots perfectly. The film will leave you satisfied with the ending yet still confused enough to want to watch it again and again. It's almost too intelligent for most audiences. Wish guy ritchie would come out with a few more of these...and the use of characters from his first version, Lock,Stock? just makes it funnier. Even the play on Brit ex-soccer player Vinnie Jones is brilliant but you have to know it to get it... If anyone tells you they didn't like it..rest assured that they just didn't get it. If you love British humor (and you can understand it) you'll love this film as much as i did.

Watched this film about 50 times I dont know why I just think it is amazing. The different stories about all the characters are amazing then they all come together at the end. Like how the milk carton out the car window starts of a massive change of effect on all the characters. Oh how I praise Guy Richie for bringing us two amazing films.

Snatch by Guy Ritchie is a wonderful comedy, and a marked improvement in his directing and sense of humor since Lock Stock (Though that is not saying that Lock Stock is bad - the contrary would be correct.The characters are created with an astoundingly sharp sense of humor, wit and cleverness, and the casting is absolutely perfect. Brad Pitt as the pikey is amazing, and Alan Ford does a perfect job of Brick Top. Vinnie Jones fits snugly into Tony's shoes, and Dennis Farina, forever the Jewish/Italian ruthless dude (see Get Shorty).The plot, it goes without saying, is woven with fine articulateness by Ritchie, and the acting is superb. Although not a movie fitting for oscar winners for the best film, the actors certainly are from the top of the class - have a look at Franky (Benicio Del Toro), Mickey (Brad Pitt), Avi (Dennis Farina), Doug (Mike Reid), and Tony (Vinnie Jones).A great performance. top marks

reviews.review_title: Just like the stone, "Snatch" is flawless
reviews.content: What a great film in every aspect.  In my opinion, the writing alone made this movie, from the classic British sarcasm, to the story itself. Everything in this movie meshed together to make it one of the all time greats.  And without that meshing, it would not have been nearly as good.

One of the best movies I've ever seen. This movie is absolutely brilliant, Guy Ritchie's style is unprecedented he is able to create an entertainment with a perfect absurd, based on a complicated story.Every part of the movie is well designed, from the soundtrack to the actors and storyline everything is well chosen.Brad Pitt shows what a good actor he is and Jason Statham proves he can be good at acting as well, not only stunts and fight scenes.I've seen many many movies, but Snatch will be one of my favorites and except for Lock Stock And Two Smoking Barrels I've never found another one like this

Well acted, well directed and well written. Snatch entertains the viewer from beginning to end with a storyline that twists and turns, humour and plenty of action. A strong cast including Brad Pitt, Jason Statham and Vinnie Jones are all prominent and give strong performances. While Statham and Jones basically play the same character in this film and others like it (Lock Stock) Pitt shows his acting range by excellently portraying an Irish traveller. As an Irish person myself I felt the accent was a small bit off but it was certainly a very good attempt. Of course, this accent would have been difficult to perfect for any actor but Pitt makes an excellent stab at it and his mannerisms are spot on.The in-your-face nature of this film is appealing and its quick paced scenes and dialogue keep the viewer interested from start to finish. Confrontations between the Irish travellers and the English gangsters are funny and well written as are the escapades of the three amateur criminals Vinny, Sol and Tyrone and their dog.Overall the film is well produced and the exciting plot keeps you guessing until the end. 8/10

i've seen snatch two times, and after the second time i still didn't completely understand it's plot. i don't consider my self as a stupid person, and i don't know why it takes so much from me to figure out all the roles in this movie. i had a hard time trying to remember who is pursuing towards what and so on. but about the movie. my opinion is that it's intelligent. no doubt that it's the best movie i've ever seen. the cuts are just great, the characters are interesting and even funny, and there are bits where you just can't stop laughing. it's kind of hectic too, and and there are some very impressive or even touching scenes (like where that gypsy's mother is burning). especially i like the movie, because it doesn't seem that "american", if you know what i mean. it's more realistic, and not at all "pompous" in the way that most of the movies are. i don't know if you get the point... snatch's got many funny details (like the dog who swallows a toy) that prevent a watcher from getting bored. and of course i have to mention the musics that make the atmosphere what it is. in the end, all i can say is that snatch is intelligent.
